Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kenm1971
Reviews.Content: Not exactly a Bed and Breakfast, but not quite a Boutique Hotel..... Somewhere in between. I will say this..... For the price, the location, and helpfullness of the staff......... YOU CAN'T FIND A BETTER DEAL!!!! The staff are SO NICE and sweet. They gave us restaurant recommendations, ideas for what to do, and even offered to setup any tours we would like to have taken!!! I just can't say enough about the staff. This is not a large hotel, but a nice, quaint place to stay while staying in New Orleans. My wife and I loved it,.... we will be back. That's a promise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: UKoutcast
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early April with my parents. From arrival to departure the owner was very helpful. From recommending places to eat to sites to see. The rooms were very clean and we loved the enclosed patio garden. I intend to return to New Orleans and will book to stay here again. I have already recommended this hotel to my friends. Thanks to everyone at Avenue garden.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Beke3300
Reviews.Content: Third time at this hotel and still loving it! The friendly staff and quaint atmosphere keep us coming back. This is a unique older hotel with flavor. Love the new (to us)fountain in the courtyard too. Large rooms with New Orleans furniture, high ceilings and privacy. We always stay in the upper rooms above the courtyard. This is not a cookie cutter hotel. There are no ice machines, soda machines, pool, etc. this is more similar to a bed and breakfast. The management will get ice for you from the kitchen until 10pm and they sell sodas and snacks in office. No parking lot, but ale parking on side streets and we have never had any problems. This is all part of why we stay here. Do not want cookie cutter. Travel a Loy and look for great alternatives. Located away from noise of downtown but easy trolley ride to everything. Walk within 2 blocks to restaurants, bars, coffee shop, boutiques. Zea's restaurant is our favorite, try the duck empanadas! Pastries and coffee served at hotel but if you want more, Tavern on corner serves excellent breakfast and bloody Mary's. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: Sue H
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and friendly. I had the room with three double beds at the very top of the property. The room is dated but clean. The bathroom had dirty wash cloths left in the tub area (ewww) and it was missing the alarm clock and blow dryer. I called the front desk and the did replace the missing items. There is no elevator so if stairs are a problem, do try to book on a lower floor. The breakfast was good to get a jump start before your day and you can get coffee/tea anytime. There was a mini fridge in the room that was clean. The bathroom was old but clean. do note that the shampoo is in ketchup packets. The room was appropraite for the value. I don't think I would stay again though. The location is really great. You can walk to the museums and can catch the street car to the french quarter or garden district. Make sure you bring quarters and singles for the street car. Slice, a nice pizza place is just about next door to the propertly. When I went outside to have breakfast in a quaint patio, the staff was there sweeping up and chain smoked the whole time I was outside.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean, comfy, great owner and staff”
Reviews.Author: LBorden
Reviews.Content: We had a room with 2 double beds. Excellent value for money. Impressed by its beauty once coming in. There is a charming interior garden, tea and coffee out all day, a good continental breakfast. All of the various management and staff made us feel like part of the family. Many comfortable interior sitting areas as well. Right on the St. Charles streetcar line, a short trip to both the French Quarter and the Garden District. Very convenient for us. Traveled to and from Jazz Fest very conveniently. Other guests were civilized and down to earth. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Zonker123
Reviews.Content: Not the Ritz, but nice if you can get a good rate. We got a double for $109. Room was a little worn down but clean and comfortable. We stayed in Room 16. Door knob to the room was loose. Could be easily fixed with a screwdriver. Old kind of TV and kind of a hodge podge in regards to furniture and decorations. Felt like we were staying at Grandma's cluttered house. Big Head Drew Brees adorned the mainhallway along with old misc. pictures and mirrors. Kind of different. Also, you actually use real keys to get in hotel and room. Wow! Shower had a little drainage problem (ended up with water around my ankles). Could be easily fixed. Cute little courtyard. You have to park in the street since they have no on site parking. But felt safe and nothing happened to car. You also have to load in through front door which has stairs to climb. Could be an issue if you have big bags, although they helped carry them in. Staff was extemely friendly! Very nice and accommodating. Check in was a breeze. I wouldn't stay for more than a night or two, but if you are on a tight budget and just need a place to sleep, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Avenue Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wvchick69
Reviews.Content: I prefer this type accommodations when in NOLA instead of the boring, newer hotels and to be an older building, it is in great shape. Good location with several good restaurants within walking distance. Parking can be an issue...we usually had luck across the street near the athletic club. Our room was clean and comfortable...it's more like a home instead of a hotel. The front desk and housekeeping staff were always friendly and helpful. We thought it was pretty quiet here considering it's located on a city street. My only complaint would be a couple issues in our bathroom in need of maintenance. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “new orleans”
Reviews.Author: groverb83
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Ave. Garden Hotel on St. Charles Ave. Most pleasurable stay ever. Keith and staff went beyond any normal customer service and really took care of our needs. If i ever visit New Orleans again i will definitely stay here again. stay was more of a homey stay then staying at a big name hotel chain. thanks for the memories.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convienient”
Reviews.Author: Charles K
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just as advertised. The rooms were clean and the location was great. The street car stop was right across the street. There is also a great daiquiri shop two blocks away. One of the best daiquiris in the entire city.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Friendly, Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: travelover1959
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights, a long weekend trip over the St. Patrick's Day weekend, March 2012. Our group included four couples, and we each had a queen room. The rooms were clean, well-appointed, comfortable, and surprisingly quiet. Super convenient location; catch the charming St. Charles streetcar right across the street. There is a great pizza place, "Slice" , right next door and Voodoo Barbecue next door on the other side, the old standby St. Charles Tavern (open 24 hours) and an Irish tavern right across the street. Service was friendly and the continental-style breakfast was just enough. Our entire group met every morning for coffee in the charming courtyard with pretty flowers and a cute fountain. A great deal, reasonably priced. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Warning !!! Not A Hotel !!! A cheap 1970's wanna be bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Randy C
Reviews.Content: First of all this is no where near a hotel. This is a cheap 1970s bed and breakfast. This is an old house and you rent a bedroom that has a bathroom that I could barely fit in. I sat in a chair in the room and dust flew out. The floors are so uneven the ironing board would barely stand. You could hear anyone who walked the halls at any time. We are a younger 30s couple that travels 6 to 7 times a year and came to New Orleans a day early and had to stay here 1 night and it was horrible. If a 1970s bed and breakfast is your cup of tea, then this place is perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sorcha N
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in New Orleans. Clean, comfortable and very homely.. My only complaint is that 'someone' on the front desk needs to take a check on 'her' mood.... we're always friendly so it's a bit of a shock to get your head bitten off for asking a question. Other than that..., it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: roxycw04
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, but VERY noisy. Our room was nice, had a lot of space, and an electric fireplace. We stayed along the back of the hotel (room 26) and the guy near the hotel uses the ally behind the hotel as a yard for his 3 dogs. The dogs were up late at night and early in the morning barking nonstop! I said something to a lady that worked at the hotel at breakfest the first morning and she just says that "oh yes, everyone complains about that" with no solution. The walls were also very thin and we could hear the conversation word for word of the people staying next to us. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique hotel in Garden District”
Reviews.Author: rcandresen
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in New Orleans. The cable car stops right in front of the hotel, but you can walk down to the French Quarter also. (That way you can justify eating a little more at one of the fabulous restaurants. They provide a nice little continental breakfast. The staff is very friendly and the hotel is very safe and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “We got lucky!”
Reviews.Author: lbgage
Reviews.Content: Lydia runs a tight ship at this hotel. The Avenue Garden Hotel staff was so friendly and helpful to our party of 4. They even gave us a room at ground level with a porch because they thought the 4 of us would enjoy our 4 day stay better. Lydia knows so much about local history and got us in touch with a tour of the Houmas House Plantation. She was a fount of information about the city and what things to do and where to be safe. We just had a wonderful time at her hotel. The room was clean, there were always enough towels and we just enjoyed ourselves. We have to give an extra thanks to Terri who cleaned our room and just took the time to chat with us and also made us feel so much at home during our first time in New Orleans. Stay at this hotel. You will be quite happy you did.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: MTFTaunton
Reviews.Content: Lovely old style Hotel with free on street parking. Our room had a balcony overlooking the street car line, took about 15 minutes to the French quarter so all in all ideal

Reviews.Title: “Depends on which room you get”
Reviews.Author: LivingIcon
Reviews.Content: There were three of us in an upstairs double room (26). The staff could only find one key to give us when we checked in. Really? The room was clean enough but dated. Funky old bedspreads. Very bland decor in the room. Missing toilet paper roll holder bar. Really? One of the mattress sets seemed worn out, somewhat sunken. The window overlooked a space between an adjacent building where two guard dogs barked at random times in the afternoon and early morning. Internet service dropped one morning of the three nights we were there. There was no coffeemaker in the room and coffee wasn't made downstairs until 8 a.m. Saturday--that seemed late to us. It was prepared by 7 on the other two mornings. The good points: Great location, easy access to street car. Friendly staff. Reasonable rate. Nice patio/courtyard. Charming hallway. We knew the hotel did not provide parking when we reserved the room. There were cones on the street in front of the hotel which provided for unloading and loading. And there was no problem finding spots to park along the nearby cross street. This would not be my first, second or third choice on future trips to New Orleans. There are so many wonderful hotels in this city. And often good deals can be found. But, when an event is going on and other places are booked up, I could see turning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Nanybel
Reviews.Content: My husband helped me choose this hotel, for my road trip with Mom to New Orleans last weekend, based on the great reviews on Tripadvisor.. I was very excited and Mom was curious since she had never experienced staying in other than fancy, more impersonal hotels. Before I start complaining, I must say that the staff is very nice and friendly and that the place looks charming and cozy. We were greeted by a nice lady called Aura and a gentleman who helped us out with our luggage; Aura showed us the way to our room. At first I thought it was very convenient because it was located on the first floor (no elevators here, of course) and in the back of the building, next to the breakfast area. It seemed to be very quiet too. The bathroom had the smallest sink I've ever seen in a hotel (or motel!); no room for toiletries and the towels were clean but pretty old. When I was ready to go to bed, the heater smelled weird, like when something is burning, and soon enough it broke; we woke up in the middle of the night freezing, and to top it of, a garbage truck stopped by and spent what seemed hours on the side of the street emptying the huge dumpsters and making the loudest noise, and a dog who lived in the building behind the hotel (right outside our window) started barking and didn't stop until late morning.... Breakfast was pretty lame: some coffee, teas, some red juice they said was apple juice, half and half, oatmeal, cake and bagels and a cheap cream cheese; no healthy protein, no milk, no fruits. After a very lovely day out, we got back to the hotel at around 10:30pm to learn that we had to move our stuff to another room on the second floor, because they could not repair the air conditioning unit. We thought that even though it was very inconvenient, (since we had to leave the hotel next morning) it was worth it, so we packed and up we went. What seemed to be a nicer and warm room with a fake fireplace, ended up being just another room right above the one we stayed the first night, with an extremely slippery bathtub, and the noise from the garbage truck and the barking dog repeated all over again waking us up way too early. I feel bad for writing a review like this, and I wish I could say that we just got and unlucky bedroom and an isolated issue, but unfortunately I can't. Mom left thinking that Ave Garden should not be considered a 'hotel'......

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Brian H
Reviews.Content: We love it and will go back. We had 3 people an a room with 2 large beds. We felt like we were staying in someone's home. The staff was great, friendly, helpful, courteous, and made us feel like family. Our cruise was detained for 2 days due to tropical storm Lee and there was no problem stayed in same room. We pack too much and they kept our overage and when we returned for one more night they were glad to see us back. The trolley stopped right in front of the Avenue but you do have to be patient fro the trolley. The cost is $1.25 each way. Breakfast the coffee cake and muffins by Melissa will be missed. After hugs goodbye we will try to get back to the avenue.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A GEM!”
Reviews.Author: midnightkitty5582
Reviews.Content: I was in need of a month plus place to stay. Had an upstairs room w a kitchen. Staff was more than accomadating! They are always quick to help or fix somethng! Prime location, great rates!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!!”
Reviews.Author: Gabi B
Reviews.Content: The mister and I stayed here during our anniversary trip, and we had an amazing time! Everyone was really sweet and really friendly, and didn't seem to mind us coming in and out of the hotel as we needed to change clothes, or retrieve items from our room. They have a continental breakfast waiting for you every morning, which turned out to be really useful when we weren't quite ready to change out of our pajamas to go to find breakfast. At first I felt kind of awkward walking out of my room to get a cup of tea in my pjs, but felt immediately at ease when I realized that everyone else was doing it too! The coziness of the hotel almost makes you feel as though you're staying in someone's house, in a way. They also have a resident kitty, who was the sweetest thing, and let me snuggle her when I was missing my own cat. The rooms are nice and the sheets are clean. There was ample storage space for clothes (a closet, and a nightstand with giant drawers). The room also came with a microwave and mini refrigerator, which was so useful to have when we wanted to snack on our leftovers from that day's dinner. The kitchenette also has a sink and some cupboards which were great for extra storage. Housekeeping was great in the sense that we didn't even know that they had been in there, until we went to the bathroom to see that we had fresh towels and that things were tidied up a bit. They very much respected our belongings, and everything was just as we had left it. One of the best perks of this hotel is that it was walking distance (or trolley distance) from everywhere that we needed to be! We walked to/from the train station which is about four blocks away. On our first night there we went walking around to familiarize ourselves with the area, and before we knew it, we were in the Quarter! It was about a twenty minute walk, and when we didn't want to walk, we didn't have to because the trolley line is right outside the front door! There are also some awesome restaurants right up and down the street from the hotel, including a great sushi place, and the tavern right next door. Also, if you find yourself running out of toothpaste or something like that, then there's a Walgreen's about three blocks away! All in all, it was a great stay. Very comfortable for a very decent price considering that we were on a budget. We'll definitely be staying here again on our next trip back!

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of the Garden District”
Reviews.Author: jloosier9919
Reviews.Content: The Avenue Garden Hotel is one of the best kept secrets of the New Orleans Garden District. This historic hotel is priced reasonably and has enormous charm. The hospitality of the staff and the ambiance of this beautiful European style boutique made me feel right at home. It is conveniently located right along St. Charles Avenue. The streetcar stops frequently almost right outside the front door of the hotel. It is within walking to distance to ATM's, restaurants, and the World War II Museum. The streetcar line (St. Charles Line) ends at the intersection of CanaI and Bourbon Street s in the French Quarter. Streetcar fare is $1.50 per trip. Free parallel parking is available on the streets near the hotel. I never had to move my car once during my stay. The staff is caring and considerate of your needs. I asked for a slightly quieter room and was accommodated accordingly with a room with a small kitchenette (refrigerator, microwave, sink, and pantry). Any requests you need, be sure and ask. On-site management is available to make sure your stay is enjoyable. Complimentary continental breakfast. Thanks to Lydia for a great stay! Will be a returning guest.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, quaint hotel...like staying in someone's home.”
Reviews.Author: jleefrog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while in New Orleans largely because of the good reviews on Trip Advisor, and we were not disappointed! This place is nestled away in the quieter Garden District (about a 10 minute cab ride from the French Quarter), and we really appreciated that it was not party central and that we could park for free along the street with no problems (not the case at Mardi Gras when there are parades, as indicated by numerous street signs). The staff were all pleasant, the hotel was quiet and clean, and it really had that old New Orleans charm. We dined in the French Quarter, but there are also some decent looking restaurants on St. Charles Ave. right by the hotel, which is right across the street from a trolley stop. Definitely recommend for adults or families traveling to New Orleans who want a pleasant, quiet, inexpensive place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We will NEVER stay at the place again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Female28
Reviews.Content: This was my boyfriends birthday and we were expecting a great vacation, but however when we arrived at the hotel there where no valet or bellmens services so we had to park a block away from the hotel and drag our bags to the hotel. Then when we make it to the hotel we had to stand outside because the door was locked and the person that works at the hotel was standing out front having a conversation with someone while we waited until she was done then she decided to open the door to let us in. We prepaid for our room online and when we finally got into our room the room looks nothing like the pictures online,the room was very small for four people to stay in. Then our A/C did not work, we did not get out room serviced becuase no one works after 1pm to clean the rooms so we had to stay in a dirty room all day and night and then when we called to complain the owner as well as her staff had the worst attitude!!!!!!!. they didn't show no concern about what we was going thru. The owner really needs to take a 101 class on how to treat her guest!!!!!!We end up checking out a day earliy because we was VERY unhappy with our whole experiance. We wasted our time and money going to that HELL HOLE!!!!! I woundn't tell a homeless person to stay there. So please do not come to this dump!!! it not worth it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel with lots of character”
Reviews.Author: Tesremos
Reviews.Content: This family owned and run hotel is located on St. Charles Avenue and dates back to the 1890s. It is comfortable and well maintained with large bedrooms and cosy public areas. The owner, Lydia, is often on hand and all of the staff are friendly and helpful. This is a quiet area of town but has an abundance of restaurants and bars within a few blocks and, best of all, the famous St. Charles Avenue Streetcar stop is right outside the front door! This lovely old-style transport takes you to Canal/Bourbon in minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Dakotacris
Reviews.Content: I feel terrible for writing bad reviews, especially when this place is a cute place, has nice staff, and is in a good area, but I have the 20-25 bites as my memento of staying here. Tthe stress of bed bugs is not worth anything. Please reconsider staying here until they have addressed this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Cute bed and breakfast type hotel”
Reviews.Author: rwells745
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to visit graduate schools, Tulane and University of New Orleans. It was in a good location, but St. Charles Avenue is a really long road, so if you plan on walking to attractions on that road, it may be a long walk, or just get on the trolley. There is a main building to this hotel. That is where the continental breakfast was - it was nice, there were some homemade cakes and other breakfast goodies. Nothing too extravagant. There was also a computer in a common area for guest use and a courtyard in the middle of the hotel. Our room was actually in a connected building above a pizza parlor. It was a nice, remodeled themed room - super cute, red, animal prints. The bathroom was also nice - marble counter, etc. When we arrived, the staff was nice, but not overly friendly, but when we called them about a problem with our air conditioner and with our phone, they responded promptly by coming right up to get the air conditioner fixed and brought a replacement phone. The only complaint about this hotel is that you have to find parking on the street either in front of the hotel, on the side of the building, in the back of the building, anywhere you can find it, which was not always convenient. Also, because our room was directly above the sidewalk and the street, we heard a lot of noise - people being loud outside, traffic, etc. There are restaurants within walking distance, and we went to the St. Charles Tavern late one night (24 hours). It was a fun little place, friendly staff, good food and drinks. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic beautiful warm & friendly place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoHelga
Reviews.Content: After checking on trip advisor I booked a room for my daughter and I for Easter week at the Avenue Garden Hotel at 1509 St Charles St New orleans La.. We were blown away with how wonderful the people running it were. Elvinia booked us in a beautiful room ( room 18) that had two queen size beds in it. It was clean, beautifully furnished, quiet and the beds were very very comfortable. The long hallway was a pleasure to walk down, the outside patio was a delight to sit and have our morning tea, the microwave to warm items was just outside our room as was the Free internet Wi-Fi computer, the maid service left the rooms in pristine shape and the people running the establishmen't couldnt have been more accomodating or kind to us. They mentioned that they had a membership to the health club across the street which we did take advantage of and they gave us free maps of the city as well as advice on where to dine, shop, or do a tour . The street car stop was right in front and the hotel is nestle between two resturants- Slice which is a casual resturant and had fantastic itlaian food on one side and VooDoo Barbque on the other side. It is also located 2 blocks from Emeril Delmonico's resturant. The street and area was very safe. We parked for the week on a non-metered side street one block down with no problems and the street car ride to and from the French quarter was approx 10 minutes. Great location, safe area, outstanding hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelinshutterbuggy
Reviews.Content: Birthday trip with my sister was amazing thanks to Avenue Garden Hotel. It is a cute, quaint, charming hotel away from the stench of the French Quarter but close enough to get there quickly. Streetcar across the street made it super easy to get there, $1.25 each way or $5 for an all day pass. Cab to get there was $10 each way to avoid the wait or people. Staff was very nice and helpful. My sister had stayed at the Doubletree near the French Quarter a few months prior and not only was it more expensive, the room was smaller and felt dingy. Our room at Avenue Garden was spacious with a granite wet bar, mini fridge, and microwave, hairdryer, iron, ironing board, everything one can need. Very cute hotel, will stay here any and everytime we visit NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: NashvegasLady
Reviews.Content: The desk clerk that met called "V" was helpful and very welcoming. I put myself in a pickle when I left my phone in a cab on my first day in New Orleans. She not only helped me get it back but she let me use her blackberry to get in touch with my boyfriend back home. No two rooms in the hotel are the same lending a feeling of specialness to the occupant. The one bed deluxe room I stayed in was very spacious and clean. There was a nice outdoor patio to hang out in that was right outside the entrance to my room. The streetcar is right out front while there are two restaurants one each side of the hotel so there was never a lack of food options. It was also very quiet and the staff respected the "do not disturb " sign which I appreciated since I'm a night person. Loved the hotel and it definintely was a big part of my awesome new orleans experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place”
Reviews.Author: Steve_GrantPark_ATL
Reviews.Content: We went down for a long weekend and have nothing but great things to say about the Avenue Garden Hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We trucked scooters down with us for a rally and they let us lock them up behind the gate in front of the hotel and also showed us where we could stash our ramp that wouldn't fit inside the truck. The hotel is clean, secure and the location is fantastic. We had dinner next door at Slice pizza and after a couple nights of drinking we had late breakfast across the street at a 24 hr restaurant. The trolley runs in front of the hotel and will take you around the city. The hotel is also a short distance from Magazine St in the Garden District where we enjoyed plenty of food. Our room was on the side of the hotel and quiet. The curtains also did a great job of blocking out the daylight and letting us sleep in late. I would highly recommend staying there and the next time I'm going to NOLA this is the first place I'll look for a room. Location wise, it cost us $10 for a taxi to Bourbon St but we didn't have to suffer from the smell of the Quarter at the Avenue Garden nor the drunken crowds. They don't have private parking but when we checked in Friday afternoon they told us they parking meters don't have to be paid on the weekend so we left the truck parked out front all weekend. Otherwise you'll have to park on the side street. We live in downtown Atlanta so we don't leave anything in our car so this wasn't an issue with us. Staying in the Quarter hotels all had a $30 per night parking.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: karzen
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little hotel that has all the charm of a traditional southern home with a good breakfast which can be eaten outside on a very cute patio. The owner and manager were wonderful - we were looked after very well (beyond our expectations) and we felt like more than just another guest on a different day and will definitely go back! We will need to go back and visit the ghosts anyway :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice neighborhood, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: suprlonghorn
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 4 days in March and were both pretty satisfied with the hotel. The front office was pretty helpful and friendly. Security or safety was not a problem since keys are given to guests just to enter through the front door of the hotel. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would stay here again. Pros: -Location: between Garden District and Bourbon St/Casino -Charm: We wanted to stay at an older, local place to get more of the NOLA experience -Service: Family owned property, always available Minor Cons: - Thin walls: Sleeping wasn't too much of a problem since we were worn out every day, but at times we were woken up by the music next door, conversations outside, and traffic/motorcycles driving by. - Restroom: Overall updated and appeared modern with a hint of charm, but not very functional. More counter space would be nice and stronger plumbing/toilets (multiple flushes were needed often)

Reviews.Title: “this is the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: lele032010
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to texas on february 18 and on my way i found this hotel in new orleans to stay overnite and I like the place, which was very comfortable and the staff and the owner was available all the time and very courtseous and helpful and they made my stay like staying at home and i will definately go back to stay in this hotel whenever i have chance to visit new orleans and i will recommend to all my friends

Reviews.Title: “the avenue garden hotel was a beaufuil place it was clean and the owner was a sweet heart and the staff was very pleasa”
Reviews.Author: kitkatt66
Reviews.Content: we had a great time the hotel was beauiful located in the heart of town the staff was very pleasant ,very clean i would reccommend this place to everyone. theres is so much to do .

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff and outdated small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Luvmyjr
Reviews.Content: This old hotel located on the edge of downtown and the garden district could be a jewel, but we were very unimpressed with management's lack of interest in customers. We were never greeted with a smile or any enthusiasm. One employee in particular was especially annoyed at our presence. The staff was not helpful when asked where to dine or what to do. The room was tiny and dated. The blankets had holes and bleach spots. The spare pillow was nasty with blood stains. Overall just worn out. All of the room issues would probably have been overlooked but became blaring due to the poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great stay”
Reviews.Author: njgeorgia
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a 4 day week end and were very impressed. This is not a 5 star lux hotel, it is what it says it is, a great old home to stay comfortably for a visit to NO. Our room was clean, comfortable, and quite. The bathroom was well apointed, good water pressure for an old home. The location was great also, with the street car line steps from the door the city is at your fingertips. BarBQue place next door with good food was convienent for drinks and a quick meal. Due to storms we had to change our flight in and out, we arrived early and left late, no problem. The owner and others at the hotel are friendly and cordial, with great tips where to go, how to get there, and when to come back. We stay at many bed and breakfasts in the Cape May area of New Jersey and have to say we were pleasantly surprised with our accomadationsThey even printed our boarding passes for us before we left, called us a cab, and talked to us while we waited. This is a real gem, and we will return. Thanks for a great get away from the snow.

Reviews.Title: “If you like the smell of disinfectant, this is for you !”
Reviews.Author: daniel37922
Reviews.Content: I am somewhat suspicious that the reviews listed for this property may not be from guests. The hotel is in a somewhat seedy location. There are rooms that face an alley where the next door pizza resaturant has trash cans that get rattled throughout the night. Upon entering the hotel you can get a strong disinfectant smell. Our room had no heat so they gave us a portable heater. Guess what? It overloaded the circuit, went off, and then the overhead lights would not come on. The first room they showed us had lamp shades missing or damaged and the outside veranda ovrelooking the street was carpeted with that green astro turf looking stuff. How this continues to get a high rating is beyoind me.

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Wait to Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Jmp05
Reviews.Content: This place was everything the positive reviews make it up to be. Firstly, the location is ideal if you are visiting N'awlins and don't quite know your way around because the street car picks you up right outside and it is the cheapest and most scenic way to get to and from the French Quarter. The staff is warm and welcoming giving you that true Southern hospitality showing you to your room and giving you a quick tour of the hotel when you check in. The rooms are quiet and comfortable and have a true historic New Orleans feel to them. The free continental breakfast had an nice variety of cakes, bagels, etc. and excellent coffee and tea. I love this hotel and wish we could have stayed longer, but know exactly where to stay next time I have the pleasure to visit this truly unique and magical city. There is just a special feeling about New Orleans that I've never felt anywhere else. We had such a great time living it up down on Bourbon Street and the surrounding hidden corners of "Le Vieux Carre." It was great to feel carefree, get a little tipsy and take the street car home! You can find parking on one of the nearby side streets. However, it is close to downtown and did not appear to be the safest place to want to leave a car and valuables unattended, so it might be worth it to pay to park in their lot.

Reviews.Title: “Will DEFINITELY stay here again the next time we're in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: derbdo
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? What a fantastic find. This is a converted home turned hotel. It has a lot of charm. Me and my girlfriend stayed for 2 nights. We arrived well early of check in, approximately 11am, but we were given a room immediately. The reception person was so sweet. She made time for small talk and gave us a tour of the entire facility. We were treated like family from the get go. The room we were given was VERY clean. It had been renovated and you could tell that they put a lot of effort into the design. The bathroom was very modern and stylish with a rain shower head. We laughed at the fact that there was a mirror over the bed! Talk about kinky. The bed was comfortable. Only small drawbacks was that there was no safe and the side tables were small so you couldn't really rest anything on them. The hotel is located a little further away from the French Quarter. You will definitely need to take a taxi or trolly to get around. Great location if you plan on seeing the Garden District or Arts area (on Julia St) or just simply getting away from the hustle and bustle of the French Quarter without going TOO far. There are BEAUTIFUL old style houses in this area if you walk further along St Charles. Tulane University is a ways down the road too. We caught a few students drinking at the local pub on our way down to the French Quarter. Very harmless, fun loving crowd! There's not much as far as dining in the area. A restaurant named Zea, but its pretty much Burger King and Popeye's from there! The bar on the corner had a great po boy though and a great bartender. I really want to take a moment though to comment about the people that work there AND the owner. Honestly, you will not find any more southern hospitality. The first night we got there, the lock on my suitcase jammed and at 10pm they made every effort to find a bolt cutter for me. The receptionist (Aura) was SO helpful and friendly. But the owner, Lydia, a sweeter lady you will not find. A true southern belle. Spend some time if you can to just talk to her. The stories she can tell and she knows so much of the history of the city. She seriously made our trip and I can't wait to come back in the years ahead to continue our conversations. I've been to many hotels in my day, but this was an experience that I will soon not forget. I will always recommend this place to anyone visiting New Orleans. Thank you to all of the hotel staff for making it a memorable vacation for us. We'll see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “The stay was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: armywife219
Reviews.Content: My husband, my son and I stayed at the Avenue Garden Hotel a few weeks ago. It was a last minute hotel choice and they were VERY friendly. We called that moring and arried that afternoon. They got us in right away and up to our room no questions asked. Our room was great. Very warm and wecoming. Not only the room but the whole hotel. The patio is amazing my husband son and I sat out there all the time! The staff was very friendly. Every time we asked them how do i get to this place or that place they would tell us and draw a map for us. It's not that far from the French Quarter. About a 8 minutes troolie cart ride. It's right next to a great BBQ place and accross the street from that is a very nice quiet little bar to get away from the comotion of Bourbon Street. I loved our stay there and they can expect me back for another visit when my husband get's back from deployment! I would recomend this hotel to anyone who would like to have a nice quiet place to stay away from downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: carolinasunshine13
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed at this hotel a number of times when it was under previous ownership, and when I had a long business related trip to New Orleans, I opted to try the hotel under its current ownership. Lydia was a great host and our room was clean, convenient to our business in the convention center. We were three adults in the room and found it spacious enough to handle three women and our luggage. Michelle, our housekeeping staff was great as well and made sure our room was stocked with fresh towels. The next time I am in NOLA, I would stay here again (if space is available). Guests can use the athletic club across the stress at no charge, and there is a desktop computer with Internet access for guest use as well. Secure parking nearby and plenty of on street parking as well. Plenty of nearby restaurants nearby within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the photos and positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: SouthernALgirl
Reviews.Content: When I travel and go on vacations I like to stay in places that are either nicer than my own home or that are equivalent to my own home. Unfortunately the room we stayed in was far worse than any of my own homes. And let me go ahead and say that I have a great appreciation for Victorian style homes because I grew up in one. When we first walked into the hotel I was very pleased with what I saw as far as decor and got a "homey" feel from the front entrance. Ora, the woman at the front desk, greeted us gave us a tour and then showed us to our room. The second she opened the door my boyfriend and I were so disappointed. The room we got was supposedly a suite but to us it was a motel. The bathroom in the room was probably the worst. Very outdated and very very small. The shower curtain was very dingy and cheap and we also found someone's hair clip in the shower. Ew. All of the fixtures were very cheap and outdated as well and the towels they gave us were basically rags. Now for the bedroom. The carpets were very worn and we even found a dead roach in the corner. The views from our windows faced dumpsters and alleys and the furniture was falling apart. I walked by one of the chairs in the room and was severely scratched by a rusty nail that was sticking out of it. Because we purchased a suite I was thinking we were going to have a refrigerator in the room but we were sadely mistaken because they only had a mini fridge in the common area for everyones use. After putting our left overs in the mini fridge we realized that there was no microwave for us to reheat our food had we wanted to eat it later. To sum it all up, I think everything was ok except for the room. I wouldn't come back here for free, until they did some major upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: KManTraveling
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay while in New Orleans. I can't say enough about how friendly and helpful Lydia and Ora were during our stay. It's a pretty hotel with a long, beautiful corridor that runs from the front of the house to the back. The room was clean and cozy. We had a corner room (room 16), so we had windows on two sides of the room which was nice. There's a resident cat roaming around that is very friendly, and does it's part to add to the character of the place. There is a nice courtyard with a water fountain and tables that is a peaceful place to sit and read or converse with friends. It's a fairly short trollie ride to get to the French Quarter, and the trollie stops right in front of the hotel. All for a reasonable price. They have hot coffee brewed throughout the day and a nice continental breakfast. I'd highly recommend Avenue Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location this side of Canal Street”
Reviews.Author: Edsad
Reviews.Content: The Avenue Garden Hotel is at a great location in NOLA. Positioned near the intersection of St. Charles and Martin Luther King Jr. Blvd, and on the St. Charles Street Car Line, the Hotel is easy to find. From this vantage point it is easy to get to all the major attractions in NOLA. There are also plenty restaurants (fast food to five clams) in walking distance. The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly. There is a large common area inside, a nice courtyard outside, and a second floor balcony overlooking St. Charles Ave . However, parking in the garage is $20/day, and it is located around the corner. There is a community refrigerator in the lobby. And the shower curtain could be replaced. The hotel has charm and personally, this puts it above average to very good.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service- we felt at home!”
Reviews.Author: pappafot
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the Avenue Garden Hotel, we were greeted and treated with great care! My sister's sudden death brought us to New Orleans. Lydia, the owner, assisted us in every way she could to make our stay comfortable and relaxing. The rooms were nice and clean. The decor is absolutely "New Orleans"! The coffee was made fresh every morning and there were always goodies out for breakfast. The courtyard is inviting and private. There are nice "living rooms" upstairs and down. We were able to congregate in the living rooms and courtyard to talk and visit. Regular hotels would not have these nice private spots in-house! Our party consisted of 15 people. We were able to keep cold drinks in the refrigerators supplied on each floor. There is a nice garage around the block, so there is no fuss with valets and tips, etc! The front balcony was a fun spot to just sit and "people" watch. The location was wonderful - not too far from the French Quarter, but not too close! I will absolutely stay there on my next visit to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Save yourself the cringing and stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: JRM_Norman
Reviews.Content: By far, worst experience of my trip to New Orleans. I know you get what you pay for and I don't expect a lot from a budget room. However, let me list the ways this place disappointed even me: 15 or so huge, Louisiana-size flies on the wall (probably due to the ill-fitting door), AC that never cooled the room, hair on the bathroom floor (and not a little, enough to make me throw a towel down), broken TV stand, lights burnt out, scary linens on the bed, etc. The owner may reply that I should have alerted them to these problems. I reply that they should know of these problems just by opening the door and checking their rooms now and then. The positive reviews of this place must have come from people who spent too much time on Bourbon Street. Save yourself the cringing and stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Bed & Breakfast feel”
Reviews.Author: jcarj
Reviews.Content: This motel was a wonderful place to stay. We enjoyed it greatly. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was convenient to Garden District and French Quarter. The motel was very clean and comfortable. Some have shown picures and said the motel was in poor condition. In my opinion, there were few imperfections. The few I saw were being repaired. The owners appear to take greatT care to meat the needs of the guest and keep the building beautiful. My favorite resident at the motel was Baby Girl. It was very relaxing sitting on the patio, rubbing her belly and listening to her purr. It was like being at home with my own pet. We have been to New Orleans several times and from now on we will certainly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Schweizerchick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days at the end of a convention - now I must say that we had been at a 4 star hotel in the French Quarter, so its a bit of a shock to move to a 2 star...however, once we settled in, we really liked it. We especially liked the little courtyard in which to have breakfast, and the living room area where we hung out to use the wireless. The room was a bit disappointing as it was on the main level, dark, and a spider paid me a visit...! However, I am sure that an upper floor would have avoided that! We loved the location..lots of restaurants out the door...rode the St Charles streetcar to the Audubon Zoo and saw the universities and the park. Walking in the Garden District is amazing. We loved the reasonable price as well, so all and all for value, this hotel is highly recommended. The staff were very friendly and helpful. You really felt like you were staying at a B and B....I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: dadofsix
Reviews.Content: The Avenue Garden Hotel was perfect for us. We were visitng my daughter at Tulane so the ride there in our car was just a few minutes. To visit the Quarter we walked out the door and the St Charles streetcar was right there. Parking at the hotel was on-street for free and never (even during Jazzfest weekend) did we park more than a block away. Having Voodoo BBQ and Slice next door was good for a late night snack and the continental breakfast in the courtyard, with its soothing fountain, was great.. But the best part may have been the hospitality. Lydia was always ready to chat, make suggestions, or assist me in any way ( I had a work project to accomplish during my weekend). We felt as if we were in a B &B rather than an impersonal hotel -- It was like a home away from home and we hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful experience”
Reviews.Author: SeeCMO
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Avenue Garden Hotel. The management provided valuable information and guidance, the breakfast lemon cake was wonderful, the proximity to the trolley was perfect. Area eateries were quite fun, convenient, and seemed wonderfully New Orleans. The Avenue Garden Hotel adds nicely to the experience of visiting New Orleans. It seemed a part of the old/new New Orleans' culture. The room I had was quite large and quite clean. The common areas in the hotel were most inviting, cozy. If you are going to be in New Orleans for any length of time try this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than staying in the Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: CessyCotton
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in the Quarter when we go to New Orleans, but after reading the reviews on Avenue Garden Hotel we decided to stay there. It was the most wonderful place! Old style New Orleans, friendly staff, and a beautiful patio. We loved our room, it was very clean and well appointed. The street car stops right in front of the hotel so getting to the Quarter was very easy. I have recommened this hotel to my family and friends. I am looking forward to my visit back this summer. Thanks you Avenue Garden for such a relaxing stay, and I will see you soon!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ajmartin1m
Reviews.Content: Everyone I met at the hotel made me feel very welcome and comfortable from the moment I arrived. This was my second trip to New Orleans and the best expierence ever. The room I had was a little cramped, but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. I was very relaxed and enjoyed the quiet, compared to staying exactly in the French Quarter. Everything you wanted to see was walking distance or you could have taken the trolley closer to town. Whenever I have the chance to return I will DEFINATELY consider staying here again. Thank you to everyone at the Avenue Garden Hotel for such a wonderful experience and great memories!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WD80
Reviews.Content: We have traveled the world over as our hobby to see new places and have new memorable experiences. One of the most important aspects of all our vacations is where we stay. We select a place based on comfort, safety, location, affordability and any special flair. Well last week, the Avenue Garden Hotel met all our expectation and more. The Avenue Garden is essentially a boutique Hotel/B&B located directly of the trolley line in the Garden District. The Hotel, built in the 1800s, maintains the style and class for todayâ€™s traveler but also is reminiscent of being at home. When you arrive, you receive a key to the Hotelâ€™s front door and a room key (not a computer chip card). If you have a car to park, then you also get a garage door opener to the Hotel garage less than 1 block away. The Hotel management and staff willingly help with your luggage, parking the car, and any else they can. I booked the hotel through Bookit.com. Bookit advertised free parking even though the Hotel expressly (I saw the emails) explained to Bookit that parking was not free. This is what was so special about Avenue Garden Hotel. Due to Bookit misinformation, the Hotel management decided to upgrade our room to a wing of the hotel where we practically had complete privacy. Now, the hotel manager did not have to open up a separate wing of the hotel just for us, but she did. She did not have to put us in a bigger room with antique amenities, but she did. She did not have to waive our parking fee, but she did. She and her staff did not have to tell us the best hot spots in the French Quarter, but they did. This was absolutely a wonderful stay at an absolutely wonder hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tales of two hotels”
Reviews.Author: NCMAja
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to stay here, especially after all the glowing reviews. Reality, however, leaves a bit to be desired. The first clue was when we checked in--"first I'll show you around the hotel, then I'll take you to the building where your room is" ???!! Up a long, steep, dark flight of stairs was a small, dark room. the "free off-street parking" promised by the booking agency was a "problem we've been trying to correct". The "light continental breakfast" may have been wonderful, but we didn't really feel like going out on the street in the early morning to get it. The brightest spot was the housekeeper, who did a wonderful job....

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent time had by all!”
Reviews.Author: Readeo1
Reviews.Content: I co-led a group of 14 runners with a few spouses headed to New Orleans for the Mardi Gras marathon. Our host Lydia and the rest of her staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were in good shape and our group all were satisfied with the accommodations. Conveniently on the street car line and easy to walk to the French Quarter, Convention Center and the river boats, I would certainly return to both New Orleans and the Avenue Garden Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at Avenue Garden the week of...”
Reviews.Author: JulieRN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Avenue Garden the week of Mardi Gras from Saturday through Wednesday. I could not have dreamed of a better vacation. First of all... Location, location, location. We were directly on the parade route, every parade passed right in front of the hotel. And the hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful, informative, and downright friendly. I felt like I had become a part of their family. They made us feel at home, had a space corded off in front of the hotel to watch the parade, Mr. Drees bbq'd some incredible meats, sausage, and veggies (with a wonderful Moroccan flair). Lydia, who I believe is the owner or manager, was incredibly nice, went out of her way to make our stay special, really bent over backwards to accomodate us. She shared with us not only the touristy things to see but also the kinda "off the beaten path" stuff. She knows slot about the city and culture. We would not stay anywhere else and are already booking our stay for next Mardi Gras. The rooms are cozy, it's a down home b&b feel. It feels like new Orleans, not some sterile made up hotel. We highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “the only place to be for mardi gras”
Reviews.Author: dreesbigsetfan
Reviews.Content: felt like home inside,staff really goes over the top to please guests.Lydia knows the best places to visit and the best way to get there. the parades are right out the front door,and great food from the grill.thanks again Lydia for a wonderful stay. send my love to jo-jo,drees. can't wait to see you all next year.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Home Away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: rrfenton
Reviews.Content: The Avenue Garden Hotel not only met our expectations but exceeded our expectations! Our family has traveled to New Orleans for over 20 years for Mardi Gras, but this experience was the best.. Rather than staying in a traditional hotel we chose the Avenue Garden Hotel. This establishment is more of a bed and breakfast than a chain hotel. We felt at home the moment we arrived. Rooms were clean, staff friendly and helpful, and the decor was beautiful. The location was perfect for Mardi Gras. Once we parked our car on Friday there was no need to retrieve it until Tuesday evening. Restaurants of all types are in walking distance. The parades are right out the front door. We always felt safe and secure whether we were inside or outside....and our children also felt comfortable outside even though it was Mardi Gras. I would highly recommend the Avenue Garden Hotel. We have already booked our rooms for next year and have been recommending this establishment to others. Not only do I now refer to this as "Home away from home"....but their staff are now like family! Thanks to the staff for a wonderful Mardi Gras...you all made our experience perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need major renovation”
Reviews.Author: travelingms
Reviews.Content: Although the owner of the hotel , Lydia,was a delight, rooms need to be renovated. I was totally disappointed as well as the the other couple we went with. I was afraid to take my shoes off. The bedspreads were old and worn as well as the furniture. My husband has had a sore back since we've been home from trip; horrible mattress. A couple of her staff were not friendly any time you asked them for a request.. There were only a few towels in the room and when we requested more, it was like a look of "how dare you!" I chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews. When economic times get better, Lydia, you must renovate the rooms. Also some soap would be nice too to shower. I wasn't going to write a review, but the last "glowing" review just put me over the edge and makes me wonder. Unless they had a spectacular room and lucked out ona last-minute cancellation, we were definitely on different planets. I would definitely not come back here unless

Reviews.Title: “Southern Comfort at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Hipichic1971
Reviews.Content: After not being able to get 2 other people to travel with us for Mardi Gras, it was getting down to the wire in finding a hotel with inexpensive rates that 2 could reasonably share. It was a last minute shot when we stopped by this hotel, hoping for a good deal. We got the best rate in town. This is a quaint hotel with lots of character. The staff was great. This hotel goes all out for Mardi Gras and set up an area in the median so that we could comfortably enjoy the parades as they passed by. Did I mention that this hotel is right on the parade route? All but Endymion. Everything is within walking distance from the hotel. When we left, we left feeling like we were part of their family. They even hugged us goodbye and asked us to call them to let them know we got home all right. We will definitely return. (Tip, if you sit on the ladder mounted to a pole on the median, you might catch a set of beads from Harry Connick Jr., like I did!)

Reviews.Title: “Seen Better Days”
Reviews.Author: soxtraveler2
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews, but felt I needed to. I was really excited about this hotel from the other reviews, and I'm not sure if it was just our room or what, but it had definitely seen better days. The room had a great deal of peeling paint and wallpaper, as well as waterspots and old leaks on the ceiling. There were picture hangers with no pictures, and the bedspread was tattered and ripped. In the bathroom, there were two different styles and lengths of curtains that only partially covered a pole. The shower grout was dirty, the tub was chipped and discolored, and there was a lightbulb out in the fixture. The exhaust fan was broken and literally looked like something had ripped through the ceiling and tore its way out of it. The bathroom was really just not appealing and we kept the door closed. The whole room wasn't visibly dirty, but I didn't feel like I wanted to lie on the bedspread or let my young daughter crawl around on the floor. I did feel like I was putting out the desk clerk when I asked for some water before we left early one morning. I also wasn't aware that there were only steps, and older-home type steps that turn midway up, which was difficult with a young child, luggage, and carseat. I guess it was mostly aesthetics, but it was not a place I'd return to. The location was convenient, especially to the streetcar, and there were a couple good restaurants (particularly the pizza place next door) and a drugstore within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “good location but dark, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSped
Reviews.Content: i suppose its like a house where location matters this place is very convenient but the room I had was small, dark and seemed poorly maintained. I suppose keeping a room in working order here must be hard with some tourists but I felt like it was the cheap apt you had when you were in college. the bathroom looked like it was repaired from holes in the wall, the towel bars looked like they were reinforced to hold people who hang on them, and the room was very tight with a large bed. Not sure if the lack of soap and shampoo was an oversight by the cleaning crew but its a disappointment when you step in bathroom to take a shower in the AM. Greet staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: HoustonMusiclover
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Avenue Garden Hotel. Although it doesn't have a restaurant on site. There's a great Italian restaurant next door and Voodoo BBQ on the other side as well as wonderful breakfasts at the St. Charles Tavern across the street as well as many other restaurants within walking distance. The trolley also runs right in front and it's a quick ride to Canal, the French Quarter and you can take a ride all the way through the Garden District from the hotel. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean. All the rooms were unique. Just don't get the front room off the front porch unless you're a heavy sleeper or early riser. Love this hotel and will always stay here when I'm in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “AVENUE GARDEN HOTEL QUAINT, PLEASANT SURPRISE”
Reviews.Author: Chubbywalker
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed here for the Cardinalâ€™s/Saintâ€™s game. As frequent visitors to NOLA, we decided to try something other than the 'Quarter. We recalled this gem from a stay last year. It is located in a former home, with whimsical detail to its dÃ©cor. Our rooms were nice size, clean & comfortable. Not large by 'chain' standards but certainly accommodating. Sorta feels like a nice B & B. No nightclubs nearby but Vieux Carreâ€™ is a 10 minute, $8 cab ride away. We were more interested in a little charm with lot less noise and no crowds in the street. Magazine St. with its shops is nearby. Plenty of nice restaurants, funky bars on this end of town plust ability for a morning run or â€˜chubby walkâ€™ down St. Charles. We appreciated the morning coffee, juices & light breakfast too. We recommend this if someone wants to try something other than the â€˜Quarter. Cool place, nice & gracious staff. Lotta bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for St. Charles Ave. location”
Reviews.Author: leohonor
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable rates for an excellent location; very convenient to a number of areas. Two Victorian style houses are combined for this hotel. Good, basic rooms with all necessities. Very accommodating, friendly and helpful staff. Rate includes continental breakfast; pleasant outdoor patio. Good restaurants within walking distance, including one of Emeril's. Although on St. Charles, the hotel is very quiet. Just walk out the door to hop on the St. Charles streetcar to French Quarter in one direction and Garden District and Tulane in the other.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is abhorrently rude, shouting at passersby from the porch”
Reviews.Author: x1ladybug
Reviews.Content: Although the Garden Avenue Hotel seems to have received very great reviews on TripAdvisor, I must say that I have personally witnessed their staff shouting rudely at locals from the porch. As a manager for a local reputable tour company, I was appalled at the blatent rude shouts and comments from a staff member. I personally book groups in hotels and bed and breakfasts in the city, both corporate and leisure, and I can think of a multitude of other overnight accomodations with the same atmosphere, location, and price point of the Garden Avenue Hotel that I would rather send my business to. I sincerely would not recommend this Hotel to anyone whether they be clients, colleagues, or family/friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: saran116
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed at Avenue Garden Hotel for 3 nights for New Year's and loved it. There were 3 of us so we got the room on the top floor with 3 beds. The staff was awesome and Lydia Blanchard was great in pointing us to the right places to go during our stay (The Laura and Oak Alley plantation tour is a must!)! It was conveniently located and enabled us to hop on the St. Charle's trolley which stops right in front of the hotel. This was our first time in NOLA and we could not have asked for a better place to stay! The next time we go back, we'll definitely be staying here! Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: nataliegoes
Reviews.Content: When you stay in New Orleans you are not looking for an Interstate Cookie Cutter motel, all sterile and boring. You want quirky, and unique and Southern, and laissez-fair. And that's exactly what we found at the Avenue Garden. It's a quirky old house (or two) that rambles forever. It's decorated with contemporary, classic and kitschy artwork. The rooms are clean and comfortable and homey. Yet they still have Wi-fi (thank god). Breakfast was yummy, we loved eating out on the porch attended by the hotel cat. If you are looking for great tour guides, that's not really their job, so take a good book. But it's New Orleans, so go open minded and anywhere you go will be interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: thedukea1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made our first trip to New Orleans to celebrate our 10th Anniversary in mid October. Lydia, gave us great advice on dining/getting around the city and is one of the nicest hosts we have encountered while traveling. Per Lydia we went to the Acme Oyster House in the French Quarter for dinner the first night...it was awesome...highly recommend the chargrilled oysters. The location was great...a ten minute trolley ride (depending on traffic) to the French Quarter. The trolley stopped outside the hotel, less than half a block away. Plenty of free parking on the side streets (thanks to Lydia for that tip)...the police station is two blocks away so the area felt pretty safe. We saw officers eating at all of the restaurants around the hotel at various times of the day. Voodoo BBQ which is next door was really good. There is also a 24 hour Tavern next to Voodoo which serves ok food. At Pizza joint on the other side of the hotel which was always packed & Emeril's Delmonico, just a block or so away across the street. As for the hotel itself, it's broken into two buildings...the main house, where you check in and the building that is adjacent to it through a very cool deck/patio area. We stayed in the adjacent building. The room was clean and had plenty of space for us to store our cloths. The only problem we had was that there was a door to an adjoining room...it didn't dull any noise. It was like we were in the room with them. Plus we could hear the police sirens and cars honking rather easy all during the night. I would recommend trying to get a room in the main building. We were in our room less then 8 hours a day, so it didn't really bother us but I could see where the noise may bother others. If all you plan to do is just stay in the French Quarter, don't rent a car. With the trolley stopping right in front of the hotel, it's wasted money....and you will pay to park if you drive anywhere...and it wont be cheap. We really enjoyed our stay and definitely will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: puddinguk
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel after seeing a few rave reviews on this site and where looking forward to something special however we where disapponted. For a start when they say parking they mean that either you pay an extra twenty a night or they direct you to find a side street to park in. We had booked and paid on line which confused the girl on reception who still thought we had to pay, she later appologised. It is unlikley that you will be able to park close to the hotel so travel light as once you arrive there are lots and lots of stairs to climb although to be fair a lady member of staff did offer to help carry some bags. The hotel does have character but that shouldnt include things like cracked mirror in the hall, silvering coming off the mirror in the bathroom etc. As you enter the room the door barely misses banging into the bed and we had a great view of a brick wall. This was the only hotel room we have ever stayed in that doesnt provide at least one bin, nor does it provide coffee making facilities. The bedhead is lovely carved wood but as a result it has sharp edges to bang your head on. The towels provided are the thin and of poor quality. After unpacking we set off to see some sights and got back a few hours later to find the room to our door wide open and two workmen inside working in the bathroom, they said they were doing routing maintence and stayed a further half hour. We later discovered that they were not doing routing maintenance but trying to fix the toilet, however they failed and the toilet continually refilled all night. The breakfast bar consists of two tables in a small alcove at the foot of the stairs, they say they provide cerials however by this they mean packets of oatmeal and grits not cornflakes etc. This would have been fine as I like oatmeal however they provide neither a microwave or kettle just a flask of warm water so that was a non starter. So we settled for toast however they only provide one toaster for all the guests and although it has four slots only two where working to there was a queue but thats just as well as there is only one small table to eat at indoors. We then thought well we will just have some orange juice but only apple is provided but if you want cake there is more than you can shake a stick at. Oh and if you have a problem with cats you may want to give this a miss as they have free run including the kitchen area. Guests are limited to certain hours at the hotel in that they have to leave by eleven pm. The walls are increadibly thin and therefore expect to be woken by any late arrvals and be heard even talking in your room. Certainly you will be woken by street noise or by any rain drumming on the air con units. In terms of location it is just too far to walk to the French Quarter but the street car does stop just outside however as this stop is at the end of the line expect to have to stand for the journey and in the evening the car may well be full and go sailing past, On coming back I misplaced my keys somewhere in the hall way and explained this to the man on reception as I was looking for them, he was indifferent and certainly never offered any assistance. This sounds a bit harsh and in fairness the hotel was ok if a bit below average its just that the comments here made it sound brilliant and its certainly not that. I am sure that there are beter value and better run in this great city. And as to the people running it they were the least helpful we have met in any hotel we have been to so far.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Hospitality, Convenience and an overall wonderful hotel experience in New Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: mishellica
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying for a full week in October 2009 at the Avenue Garden with a group of 10 friends on a rebuilding vacation. During that week my friends and I felt so welcome and relaxed due to the hospitality of the owners Lydia and Melissa as well as their staff. The hotel has the feel of a bed and breakfast that is set in a beautiful and unique building that I dare say feels very "New Orleans". Our group had 3 rooms, each was comfortable, clean, and quiet. The hotel is located right off of the St. Charles Streetcar, so it's very convenient to get to the French Quarter from there. The hotel is within short walking distances to many restaurants (including the excellent Voodoo BBQ downstairs), bars, as well as a Walgreens and Borders. Lydia and Melissa were happy to recommend places for us to experience, things to do, and great restaurants as well. One evening our group was hanging out in the parlor/lounge room before we were going to head out for the evening, and we starting talking with Lydia and some other guests. We ended up staying in the whole evening playing cards and talking and had a great time. The best part was that Lydia cooked out on the grill in the courtyard and offered Shrimp and Linguini for dinner to us. Staying at the Avenue Garden ended up not being just a place to rest during our New Orleans vacation, it actually played a part in creating a memorable and wonderful New Orleans experience. I totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Frequent travelers, nicest staff EVER encountered!!!”
Reviews.Author: ShelBama
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Avenue Garden Hotel was perfect! Our room was very nicely decorated, high ceilings, elegant bathroom, comfortable bed; everything you hope for, but don't always find. The location couldn't have been better. The trolley stopped outside, less than half a block away. There were also amazing restaurants within short walking distance. We ate lunch at voodoo barbecue every day because it was so good, not to mention the Purple Haze on tap. We walked to dinner at Emeril's Delmonico, just a block or two away. There is also the 24 hour Tavern across the street for late night fare. Of course we started each day with an amazing complimentary breakfast at the Avenue Garden which included this amazing cake! We don't usually eat cake for breakfast, but it is New Orleans, and it is a decadent way to start a decadent day. We also can't say enough positive things about the staff! They were unbelievably kind and helpful!!! They went above and beyond any expectations to help us fulfill our slightest whim, even in the middle of the night! I have traveled to New Orleans frequently, and we do not want to stay anywhere else during future visits. It really couldn't have been a more positive experience!

Reviews.Title: “This is my "go-to" place to stay in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: collegemama
Reviews.Content: In August, I was in New Orleans to move my son into college and attend freshman orientation. I am thrilled to have found Avenue Garden! Immediately, I felt like I was a special guest in a private home. Lydia, the owner, is so gracious and attentive. The building is filled with old-fashioned southern charm, original art, and lovely comfortable furnishings. The continental breakfast is filled with a variety of pastries, breads and cereals, hot and cold. The hotel is surrounded by a variety of restaurants and the streetcar stops right in front, convenient to both the French Quarter and the Garden District. I am certain I will be staying there frequently over the next few years of my son's university tenure, and I look forward to the many opportunities to spend time w/ my new friend, Lydia!

Reviews.Title: “cozy and familial”
Reviews.Author: moni1712
Reviews.Content: + friendly and helpful staff + Breakfast in the morning + Internet access + surrounded by cute little restaurants + close to the french quarter + close to the garden district + streetcar station right across the street

Reviews.Title: “Homey, comfortable, beautiful,convenient, and outstanding art”
Reviews.Author: mogtog
Reviews.Content: It was our second stay at the Garden Avenue and we like it so well we've already made reservations for next year. This is a weekend of the Jazz Festival and also our Anniverary weekend so we knew we would have a special time at this hotel. Lydia, the manager, started the same day we first stayed at this hotel. She has really beautified the building and added many personal touches that make this place gorgeous and comfortable. The staff is very courteous and helpful. The location is wonderful as it is at the end of the Garden District and the St.Charles streetcar is directly across from the hotel. Fine dining and casual dining is within walking distance. The price is very reasonable. We can't wait to return to this wonderful place. New Orleans is coming back.

Reviews.Title: “No other way to go”
Reviews.Author: JSchultz80920
Reviews.Content: This hotel was cozy, conveniently located and allowed you to feel as a resident for a stay, instead of just a hotel guest. The private entrances, charming courtyard and extremely friendly staff can't be beat. The trolley car picks you up right in front of the hotel, and is wonderful for heading out into the Garden District to see the history and architecture, or to take you to the French Quarter for some serious partying. If you are going to New Orleans, definately stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than your typical hotel stay!”
Reviews.Author: travellingamy77
Reviews.Content: I am a college student on a road trip and am used to just those typical Days Inn type places. I chose this hotel for it's (most importantly) rate and lack of bed bug reports, proximity to the French Quarter, and ability to put my car somewhere safe. I am very easy to please- all I really require is a safe, clean, place to sleep and this hotel went WAY above my expectations. The woman at the desk was very helpful. We couldn't figure out how to get the shower to work (but I am stupid and do this everywhere =) ) and she helped us find our way around with a map and good directions. Breakfast was amazing. I made myself some hot oatmeal, toasted a bagel with jelly, and a small piece of chocolate cake. We had our breakfast courtyard/patio type place right by the room. Our room is small, which is fine we paid $60/night for it, but for what it is it looks so pretty. I feel like I cheated the budget, but I didn't. We have everything we need, a spacious marble bathroom, and even a little kitchen area for a sink and microwave. Parking is $20 a day, in a garage around the block. I looked all over, parking is around this rate anywhere (hotel wise) near French Quarter. I feel safe with my car there. There is a $1.25 trolley right across the street that takes you to/from the French Quarter. We ate at both the pizzeria and the bbq restaurants directly on either side of the hotel and they were really cool with good food. This place is very cute, it is not the same as walking up and down the creepy hallways of a dreary chain motel. We were greeted by everyone we saw, staff and visitors. It is unique and definitely well worth a stay. It goes above and beyond a typical hotel visit.

Reviews.Title: “Little Hotel with Lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: Jdiddy78
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Avenue Garden Hotel just past 9pm on Thursday night. As we walked toward the hotel my girlfriends phone began to ring, just as we were about to answer we walked past a lady on the steps of the hotel on her phone, she paused and asked if we were the two people who had called her earlier lost?
