We replied we were, and she informed us she was calling to tell us there was an open parking spot in front of the hotel and she had been waiting out front for us. That is how we met Litya, the hotel manager, a charming southern lady who then took the time to show us around the former townhome (my guess) that was our hotel. She answered all of our touristy questions and even recommended The Acme Oyster House to eat, which became our favorite (try the char-grilled oysters!). About the hotel: This is a quaint, small hotel, it is not the Marriott or Hilton. We were looking for something that was had the character of the city, and in my opinion this place has it. The room was medium size, good enough for two people, it had an old fireplace that had been sealed, nice king size bed, tv and window a/c unit that definitely kept the room cool (I keep my house at 72 degrees year round, I like it cold, I cannot sleep if it's hot, and the window unit definitely worked!) The bathroom was a little small, but if you're only complaint is that you wish there was more bathroom space, that's a good thing. There was a continental breakfest served every morning, I didn't partake, as half the reason for the trip was to have NOLA food, but I saw groups of people each morning eating together on the patio sitting area. Coffee was ready every morning, which I did have. The area is great, lots of restaurants around the area. The tram picks up across the street which you can take to Canal Strret across from bourbon for $1.25 each way. Also, we took taxi's home each night from Bourbon street, and it ran from $7-8 each time. The front door of the hotel is locked at all times, you are given a key at checkin, so we always felt very safe. All in all, we enjoyed our stay, and the hotel definitely added to it, wouldn't hesitate to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A Southern Gem”
Reviews.Author: Gooner666
Reviews.Content: Just returned to the UK after an extended trip to the USA and must admit enjoyed New Orleans the most! A fabulous small hotel that just oozes zstyle and has charming staff. The welcome you receive and atmosphere during your stay is brilliant and Lydia is most helpful. Close to the street car so no need for your own transport. Excellent bars and places to eat on your doorstep. If you want generic hotel rooms courtesy of a chain don't stay here...if you want a style, ambiance, a warm welcome, good advice and excellent coffee in the courtyard, the feel of a Louisiana welcome and excellent value for money then this is the place for you. I will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky! Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: travelbuddy32
Reviews.Content: This was our second night on a cross country drive. Room was clean and looked just as nice as the pictures online indicated. Staff was helpful and courteous. Parking is limited. Steps from the trolley line. Would have loved to stay another night and would definitely return if in New Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the size”
Reviews.Author: duppykiller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend in October, and have to say I was impressed. Although the rooms are a bit small, being that it is a house converted into a hotel. The staff on site are wonderful. All were extremely helpful and friendly!! They all suggested places you can eat, nightlife, etc. Not too far from downtown NO and Bourbon street, though I had rented a car, the trolley was convenient being right out the front door of the hotel. Takes about 5-10 minutes to get to downtown NO by car. Very convenient. Would definitely stay here again!! Thanks for a great stay and excellent hospitality!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: storie444
Reviews.Content: the hotel was fantastic, it had a very nice New Orleans feel and the staff was great. Manfred, a member of the hotel staff, was very helpful in finding local places and cool clubs/bars to just chill; He also was very hospitable and was always up for friendly conversation. The owner also changed are room for free when she found a mistake in our booking. Her and her partner were very nice. The honeymoon suite is beautiful and well decorated with unique furniture and artwork. The whole hotel has a very "homey feel" and the building itself has an old style motif throughout its hallways. I loved sitting on the patio under one of the big umbrellas and just smelling the local eateries. There are several excellent restraunts around the hotel and a trolly car across the street for easy transportation. They made me and my partner's honeymoon a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jgfarned
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed here twice, we liked it so much the first time. This is an older property, (window-type AC) and the rooms are small. If you're used to places like Hilton or Hyatt, the Avenue Garden may be a bit of a culture shock - there's not even a proper "front desk," just a window. That being said, the staff is wonderful, the rooms are clean, there's free internet access, a lovely courtyard patio, and a New Orleans-style rooftop balcony that looks onto St. Charles. Not the part of St. Charles in the Garden District - that's further uptown; this is a slightly grittier, but still pretty nice, part of St Charles closer to the Quarter. This has been the major selling point for us: location, location, location. There's a street car stop right across from the hotel, and a cab into the heart of the Quarter is not expensive from here either. There are two tavern-type bars at either end of the block that are both open 24/7. (The St. Charles Tavern used to have awesome food, but is under new management and now the formerly delicious gumbo tastes like it came from a can. Bring back the old SCT!) There is a pretty good fast-food style BBQ place next to the hotel, and a truly excellent - and very reasonably priced - gourmet pizza place on the other side. Oh, and a new sushi/Japanese place just opened a few doors down (haven't gotten to try that one yet). In short, the Avenue Garden is surrounded by fabulous food choices, is close to both the Quarter and Uptown, and is a wonderful mix of New Orleans personality and professionalism. If you're looking for something different from the big chains, I highly recommend this place. It's not luxurious, but definitely worth the very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but quite far from the French quarter”
Reviews.Author: JoW2009
Reviews.Content: Rather far out from the French quarter if you are only staying for a short time, but nice that it is in different district so you are close to other things instead. Street car stop just outside, which takes you to French quarter for a couple of bucks. But as most restaurants and music are in the French quarter you need to factor in a ten buck cab ride to get you back in the evening - for that price there are nice places in the French quarter which are still quiet enough. Rather eccentric staff - muddle over reservation wasn't fun to deal with when arriving. Otherwise helpful and very nice that they extended check out time to fit in with our flight departure.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home away from home”
Reviews.Author: 1supermom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 11-year old daughters. The room was comfortable. There was a sitting area right outside our door with a sofa, table, and internet, which was convenient for reading and playing board games with the kids. There are two small restaurants on either side of the hotel (Italian and BBQ) so we walked next door, picked up dinner, and returned to the hotel to eat on their wonderful patio. Our room also had a small refrigerator. Ms. Lydia and Mr. Manfred couldn't have been kinder, and took care of our every need. The trolley stops right in front, and for five dollars, we all rode into the Garden District and the French Quarter. We plan on staying here again! (p.s. Thanks for the tea, Manfred!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel........Felt like we were visiting old friends!”
Reviews.Author: jkoscin1
Reviews.Content: Wanting to get away for a short 3 day vacation, this hotel was the perfect choice. Upon arriving earlier than check-in, Lydia,our hostess, alllowed my wife and I to relax in the comfort of our room, and made us feel welcome. The room was extremely neat and clean, and the king-sized bed was comfortable. There was a very good continental breakfast served daily, with fresh coffee, baked goods, and juice. We enjoyed relaxing in the courtyard before we started our day. Lydia was helpful in suggesting itineraries during our short stay, and helped us make travel arrangements as needed. It didn't hurt also, that the streetcar line was located in front of the hotel. All-in-all, if you're looking for a great place to stay, without the impersonal feel of a large property, you won't go wrong staying at this hotel. We're looking forward to returning in the future!

Reviews.Title: “classic and charming new orleans style”
Reviews.Author: shadesofpale
Reviews.Content: avenue garden hotel is located on the st. charles streetcar line, which makes it incredibly easy to travel from uptown to downtown and to the french quarter. it is secure, with actual keys given to guests that unlock a series of doors leading to the rooms. the suites were large and roomy and the bedding was especially comfortable! amenities were more than i expected (fridge, ironing board, microwave, kitchen type sink) and the staff was very helpful through my stay. i recommend staying here not only because it is locally owned and managed, but because it provides a guest with an authentic new orleans experience.

Reviews.Title: “So very New Orleans, and so very nice!”
Reviews.Author: bayouboy99
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love, love, love this hotel. My stay here was fantastic. Lydia, the manager (owner? not sure) is as sweet and helpful as she can be, and hotel staff are kind and always ready to help with anything. The location on St. Charles means a $6 cab ride to the French Quarter in one direction and Uptown in the other. This means you're not far from the party, but when you've had enough you're a cheap cab ride to your quiet hotel room. Also, the location means hailing a cab at most hours of the day/night is super easy. The room was spotless, the bed was comfortable, the patio was precious. Stay here! You won't regret it. The price is so good I'd even call it underpriced. Highly, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality meets Southern Charm”
Reviews.Author: twoscoopsoflove
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights in this amazing hotel. Lydia, Melissa, Manfeard and all the staff are always willing and glad to help. I had everything I needed and was very comfortable for my entire stay. The room was very clean, and the hotel decor is charming! The hotel is very secure, and someone is always available for any need. The location is superb. Not even five minutes from Downtown and the French Quarter, and within walking distance to many restaurants, shops, and bars. I can't wait to come back and stay at Avenue Gardens, my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally charming hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: gatordoc96
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a brief overnight passage through town and found this wonderful place on trip advisor. The staff treated us like family from the moment we arrived. They went out of their way to accommodate our parking needs after a late arrival. The rooms were very charming with antique dÃ©cor and modern amenities! Great location on St. Charles street by the garden district with street car access a few steps away! We have been to New Orleans several times and wish we could have stayed here sooner!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for my first visit to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: rbc709295
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avenue Garden Hotel the first week in June and I have to say that I have never enjoyed myself more. I booked through hotels.com and so when I arrived, I just had to stop by the desk and pick up the keys to the room. Lydia is the owner of the hotel and she is just about the nicest person I've ever encountered while traveling- extremely friendly, warm, and hospitable. When I asked her how far it was to Union Station, she offered to drive me there to pick up my grandmother - THEN she gave us a personal tour of the French Quarter! It was so pleasantly unexpected and wonderful; my grandmother and I enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. There are about 40 rooms in the hotel in 3 separate sections. Our room (#17) was right off of the Magnolia Room which is a common area with a living room feel (couch/chairs), a computer (with free internet access), and a dining room table - oh and let us not forget the AIR CONDITIONING!! Our room had 2 beds and a large bathroom with everything clean and comfortable and exactly what we needed for our 2 day visit. I also got a little tour of some of the other rooms with king beds in them and original brick-work and pre-war shuttered windows/doors and they're all individually fantastic!! The hotel is decorated with Lydia's family's art (mother and brother), giving the entire hotel a homey and personal feeling instead of that hotel-mass-produced prints of flowers and fruit - you can even purchase some of the art if you are so inclined. The patio seating area was gorgeous with the painted mural and potted flowers. The wrought-iron tables and chairs were beautiful to look at and surprisingly comfortable to sit and relax on and with the smells coming from VooDoo BBQ right next door...how much better could it be?!?!?! My grandmother uses a walker and was finding it a bit diffcult to get up and down the front stairs of the hotel so Lydia kindly offered us a personal key to the side gate so we could use the ramp up to our room - much appreciated by my gramma I can tell you! She also offered to call a cab for us anytime we went out touring and recommened places to eat and visit when we'd stop by the office. Melissa was also extremely friendly and helpful with anything we needed during our stay and always made a point of asking how we were and what sights we saw that day - and actually listened when we told her! These are the little things that make or break a stay for me when I'm away from home and I because of the service and facilities at Avenue Garden, I've already started planning when I'll be back to book this hotel again for my next trip to N'awlins! Honestly, I could go on about my experience at Avenue Garden Hotel but the bottom line is that it all comes down to this: It is a small, intimate, friendly, extremely welcoming, and priced-just-right hotel that should be enjoyed by as many visitors as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Small Hotel with Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: joe_travelerSoCal
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent two nights and we were totally pleased. The "street car" on St. Charles in front of the hotel runs every few minutes and takes you straight to the French quarter. In the other dirrection, it takes you past old mansions, a beautiful park, and old universities. The hotel is in a nice neighborhood and consists of three smaller buildings attached by a nice enclosed private patio. Room 13 was nicely appointed and even thought it was near the front desk, we never heard any noise. It had its own air conditioner. Melissa was especially helpful as were all the staff. 24 hour street parking was just around the corner for our rental car, or you could pay $20 for the hotel to privide parking. I prefer smallher hotels and Avenue Garden met all our expectations. Joe and Sophie

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: cam100648
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel several years ago and enjoyed it then. It is now under new ownership and it is even nicer. They made many upgrades and added a really personal 'New Orleans' touch to the premise. Great location. We got a day pass for the RTA and toured New Orleans for $5.00!! Hotel is situated between a pizza parlour and a bar-b-que place. Both had wonderful food and we ordered food to go and sat on the hotel's front patio and ate while we watched the people, street car, vehicles, etc. go by. Very fun!!! We think it is the best deal in town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and very nice people”
Reviews.Author: meruk
Reviews.Content: my som and I spent 2 nights at the Avenue Gardenhotel. The staffwere fantastic. Our room was nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a homey charm!”
Reviews.Author: randalv
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We stayed here for 3 nights (on a weekend between major tourist events) and felt perfectly at home. The owner gave us a tour and was very nice, as were the staff. It's a small business and a small, non-chain hotel with a family-run feel. The rooms were spacious and clean, nothing fancy, but a great deal for the price. A simple breakfast was included and we enjoyed ours every morning on the outdoor patio. The trolley stops right out front on St. Charles and for $1.25 will whisk you to the French Quarter in <10 minutes, or in the other direction, towards Uptown. The trolley Uptown (towards universities, cemeteries, Audubon Park, etc) was a highlight in and of itself for its 20+ minute parade through miles of scenic, stately, classic New Orleans houses. We had no trouble getting a cab outside the hotel on St. Charles either when the trolleys filled up, which they do when things are happening in the Quarter. I'd definitely stay here again. Just enough off the beaten path to quietly regroup between outings, but with easy access to everything New Orleans has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Charm and Character!”
Reviews.Author: CTJeremy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary with a trip to New Orleans and chose the Avenue Garden to spend the 5 nights in. We weren't exactly sure what to expect as the rate was almost "too good to be true" but were very pleasantly surprised! We wanted a hotel with a local feeling as we can stay in a generic high rise chain hotel anytime in that is exactly what this property offers, it felt more like a BnB than a hotel. The staff were all very helpful and responsive to our requests and questions. The location, right on the streetcar line, made our many trips to the French Quarter and the historic Garden District a piece of cake! We will definitely be back to New Orleans and would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Place”
Reviews.Author: Jill M
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the end of March. It has more of a B& B feel than a hotel, the rooms were clean & spacious. Lydia was a gracious host who helped us with directions and questions. Alvina gave us great restaurant ideas. The Street car is right out front which worked out well to get around the city. The breakfast was good for continental we loved sitting out on the patio with all the flowers. The staff was great someone was always aorund if you had a question:) Thanks for the wonderful stay!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, nice people, and great location.”
Reviews.Author: osiris321
Reviews.Content: My GF and I stayed four nights here and we liked it a lot. The staff is very helpful, our room was roomy and clean, as were the common areas. The price couldn't be beat. Continental breakfast was nice and well-done. Our room did have a framed mirror on the ceiling over the bed, which I wasn't keen on, but just ask for a room without one if that doesn't appeal to you, and they'll be happy to oblige. We wanted some extra blankets and the manager brought us a new comforter, still in its packaging. She also helped us to arrange for taxi service and was just generally very helpful. You can't beat the location, just walk out the door and you're on the St. Charles streetcar line. You don't even need a car to get to the Quarter or to the heart of the Garden District. Enjoy your stay in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and a good value!”
Reviews.Author: jsgemnet
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Avenue Garden hotel on several visits to New Orleans and it gets better each time. The new owner is a super nice lady who's doing her very best to make your stay comfortable, enjoyable as well as affordable! The Garden District location is exactly where I want to be. Give this hotel a try!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Southern Hospitality and Staff in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Lizcara
Reviews.Content: Great value, wonderful location, charming accomodations, good security, BEST STAFF ever. My new home away from home in New Orleans. You will love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, really nice staff, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: jimbojones007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 nights at the Avenue Garden Hotel starting the day after Mardi Gras and the staff could not have been more helpful or accomodating. The streetcar stops right in front of the hotel whichever direction you want to go, whether heading towards the end of the line up Carrolton for some nice restaurants along the way or to the end of the line at Bourbon and Canal Streets. We bought a 3 day pass for the streetcars and certainly got our moneys worth but we also walked right to the waterfront and into the French Quarter because we both enjoy walking for hours at a time for the exercise and to see the sights first hand rather than from the back of a taxi, tour bus or streetcar. The continental breakfast was a good start to the day however there is great pizza/pasta/salads next door (http://www.slicepizzeria.com/) or the Voodoo BBQ (http://www.voodoobbqandgrill.com/st.charles.html) on the other side of the hotel. I would recommend staying here to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted for Mardi Gras!”
Reviews.Author: cruiser890
Reviews.Content: Great location to watch Mardi Gras parades. Staff was friendly and motivated to ensure guests enjoyed themselves. A great continental breakfast was provided as well as snacks and coffee all day. Only drawback was the price to park - a bit more than the average N.O. hotel. We will definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel Ive ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: MyPaperLion
Reviews.Content: I went to New Orleans for a music festival with some friends and stayed at The Avenue Garden Hotel. Not only is it close to town but The staff are some of the nicest people I have ever met. They went out of their way to help my friends and I and I am eternally grateful for all the help I received while i was there. They really care about you as a person and how youre getting along. The hotel was extremely comfortable and homely and I wont ever hesitate when I have to pick a hotel to stay at when I'm in New Orleans. Stay at this hotel. You wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Classic New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: nbtterfly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is run by the nicest people in the world! If you are unfamiliar with New Orleans this is the place to stay. The staff is incredibly helpful in helping you find where you need to go and making recommendations for things to do. The hotel itself is located right along the path of one of New Orleans best Mardi Gras parades and beads hang in the trees along St. Charles year round. It's the ideal location for visiting the French Quarter because the street car line stops right outside the hotel! You have easy access to all of the best New Orleans sights at the same time as staying in one of the quieter parts of town. The hotel building is small and quaint and the ideal location for your 'classic' New Orleans vacation! I have stayed here on two occasions and you CANNOT beat the quality of the hotel for this price. I will never stay any where else when I visit New Orleans!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pipsterLA
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this cute little hotel for a weekend, and we absolutely LOVED it. The staff were fantastic (Manfread even bought us special cream cheese for our bagels in the morning!) - they were helpful, nice, accomodating, and friendly. The location was great - right on historic St. Charles Ave, where you can take a streetcar down the road to look at old beautiful NOLA houses, and also close to the French Quarter. We definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Easy in teh Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: AryanPrince
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were professional, warm and extremely friendly. In fact in all my travels I have not come across a more "down-to-earth" bunch. Interaction with them was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful True New Orleans Hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie17Calera
Reviews.Content: Wow what a neat find!! I was in New Orleans on a business trip. Wanting to save money I booked this hotel. Wow what a surprise did I get for my money!! Upon walking thru the door I knew it was going to be a treat. Lots of wonderful New Orleans character. Building was built in 1800s with high ceilings, windows, and doors. After I checked in the desk clerk walked me to my room, showing me the balony I was welcomed to use, and the breakfast room as well. The staff was extremly friendly and helpful. As a women traveling alone, I felt very save and secure staying here. I'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: dack6849
Reviews.Content: My wife had flight coupons that needed to be used before the expiration date. We wanted to go someplace we've never been for a long weekend. We chose New Orleans. Knowing very little about the city or the hotels, I chose to try to save money by using Orbitz.com. We took a shuttle from the airport to the city. We were the last stop since our hotel was not in the city, but in the Garden District. Again, we didn't really know what that meant. Everyone else was dropped off at a high rise hotel that can be found in any city USA. Our hotel was an old 2-story hotel in a very quaint part of town. We entered the hotel and began what was one of the most wonderful weekends we have ever enjoyed together - and the Garden Avenue Hotel was a big part of the perfect weekend. The accommodations were perfect. The staff is incredibly friendly and the surrounding area is amazing. Upon leaving, my wife and I commented that our stay was much more like a Bed and Breakfast than a hotel. Lydia, Alvia and the rest of the staff went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed saw the highlights of the city. I will never stay any place else and highly recommend The Garden Avenue to anyone traveling to New Orleans. By the way, if you look at a map and it seems the hotel is too far from the city, the street car will get you to the intersection of Canal and Bourbon in 10 minutes. Taking the street car the other direction will lead you into one of the most beautiful neighborhoods in the world. Take it all the way to the end, eat at the Camilla Grill and enjoy a walk back past Tulane University and Loyola University, the beautiful old houses and down Magazine Street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Quaint”
Reviews.Author: sachsemom
Reviews.Content: I would definately stay here again. The rooms were nice and the atomosphere was that of a quaint bed and breakfast. The staff were accomodating, helpful and knowledgeable offering information on tours and restaurants. One of the best places we ate was Voo Doo BBQ which is right next door and Stop 9 which is just across the street. I recommend a swamp tour through Louisiana Tour Co. It's a bit pricey for the air boat tour but well worth it. Our guide was charming, funny and full of New Orleans history! The Haunted History Tour was mediocre at best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location”
Reviews.Author: wjg63
Reviews.Content: We went down to NOLA for a long weekend and picked this place after a little web searching. Our room was very comfortable and recently renovated. The staff was friendly and helpfull. Emeril's is a 2 block walk away. The Garden District has become a little more sketchy of a neighborhood post Katrina, but is still one of the nicer parts of New Orleans. Lots of good restaurants in easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “would go back”
Reviews.Author: europeanfly
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well located and the street car is right outside the door so its so easy to get in and out of the french quarter and bourbon st. The room was perfect for me as a solo traveller, the bed was huge and the decor had an old french feel about it. The staff were very helpful in advising me about tours and places to go and see. I didn't spend much time in the room but carpet on the floor could have been hoovered a little and water in the shower was cold at times but overall i had an enjoyable stay and the neighbourhood is safe and quiet

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!!! Best deal in NOLA!!”
Reviews.Author: travel4workAA
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary and loved it. We booked on the website last minute and got a great rate. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. They offer off street parking for $10 a day, which is very affordable and recommended. The location was perfect ~ right on the trolley line. There are several local restaurants and bars that are very close and very affordable. The rooms are like an old boarding house and very romantic. The court yard is great for just chilling with a few drinks and friends. I recommend this place to anyone who wants a try New Orleans experience at a great price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss”
Reviews.Author: wynot
Reviews.Content: The Avenue Garden Hotel is not for everyone but if you are comfortable with some compromises, it's a good value. We travel often and prefer off-beat, privately owned properties so the Avenue Garden was right up our alley. That said, there are both pros and cons. On the upside, the location in the Garden District is convenient to the street car, dining and the New Orleans vibe is palpable. It should be noted that the hotel offers very limited parking in its garage around the block (with a glitchy garage door) so you may be parking on the street any where within a several block radius. Keep that in mind if you are uncomfortable leaving your car unattended the neighborhood. The hotel does have a loading zone in the front and we were able to park there long enough to move our bags in and out. Upon check-in, we were given a room without a shower curtain but with clothes and personal items in the armoire (the result of a minor miscommunication, as it turns out). Those things were easily remedied but the door didn't lock and that was not! We were moved to another, less desirable room for the night and then moved again to a nicer room the next day. Having seen three rooms, I can honestly say that the furnishings are a little bit dinged but the beds are comfortable, the bathrooms functional, and the overall level of cleanliness is quite good. There are some oddities afoot however: despite two network hubs, there is no wi-fi - no connectability, no signal - but there is a computer for use in a common area and it had good internet speed. All three rooms we saw had ironing boards but only one had an iron. One room had only one lamp and it was in the opposite corner from the beds. There were no hairdryers. If you are traveling by car, seriously consider bringing your own pillows. On the plus side, the staff was very pleasant and accommodating. The owner is making upgrades to the property. We got a bargain rate and overall the accommodations were well in line with what we paid. I was really only frustrated with the defective door lock (I'm told it's been fixed) and the lack of wi-fi which truly was maddening.

Reviews.Title: “Avenue Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChristinX1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this quaint hotel every time I've been home to visit New Orleans (since Katrina), and each time it gets better. Avenue Garden is now under new ownership, and the lovely Ms. Lydia is simply awesome. She's friendly, and she cares about her guests. She is updating/repairing the rooms, which has been a work in progress since Katrina, and I'm happy to see it. The rooms themselves are small, but they suit me fine, as I'm not there to sleep - I'm there to visit and have fun! I'm rarely in my room. There is a nice sized TV, alarm clock, and efficient AC. If you are in a room nearer to St. Charles Ave, you might hear the streetcar pass by in the evening/morning, but to me it's a soothing sound (I'm happy they're back!). There is a computer for guest's use in the lobby, and there is now an assortment of breakfast items there, as well (this is new - it used to be just coffee) - muffins, sweet rolls, juice and the like. There is no elevator, so be prepared to not only walk up the front steps, but to your room if you're upstairs. I request a 1st level room when I stay there. Location-wise, I don't think there's a better deal in the city. Right Uptown/Garden District on the St. Charles streetcar line, and just a few dollars for a United into the CBD, Quarter or Marigny. It's walking distance to Magazine Street (4 blocks), and there are several excellent restaurants, bars and shops right on St. Charles Avenue, as well (Slice, Miyako, St. Charles Tavern, Sushi Brothers, Voodoo BBQ and Lucky's, to name a few). Until I move back home, this is where I'll always stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Wonderful Avenue Garden”
Reviews.Author: PedroAguayo
Reviews.Content: We arrived in New Orleans planning to stay with a friend, and when plans changed we went on Orbitz and searched for a nice Hotel within our friends living area. Low and behold we found a great deal for the Avenue Garden Hotel. Now for the price we got through orbitz for the hotel, well I'll just say we really appreciated it. This Hotel was magnificent, beautiful, and truly New Orleans style. The rooms were so fabulously decorated in old French Quarter, the staff was extremely pleasant. Everything was so convenient to get to. I know when I go back I'm booking this hotel even if I have to pay triple the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine with me”
Reviews.Author: ManandDan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine with me. The staff was more than accommodating when I had to change the reservation date several times. We had room #28. Our bed was very, very comfortable. The bathroom was immaculate. I am VERY picky about a clean hotel bathroom and I was impressed. The tub was sparkling white with no sign of dirt or mold anywhere. The hotel is old and the furniture in the room was slightly scratched, etc. But, who cares about a dresser or night stand you aren't going to use! We did only stay one night, so I cannot comment on the maid service. Also, we did not park in the garage, so we did not have to pay the $10 parking fee. I would definitely stay there again...........

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: transafe
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a new owner and she is doing a great job of upgrading the facilities. She is gracious and has great southern hospitality and charm about her. It is a great place for people who like to see New Orleans away from French Quarters. Great restaurants next door.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Spot! Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: QueenSt11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel a few weekends ago while in town to attend my granddaughter's graduation from Loyola. The hotel is the quintessential bargain for college parents and is in the greatest location - not quite in the french quarter and not too far uptown. The hotel is located right on the trolley line (with RTA passes available at the front desk) and the ride to campus or downtown is no more than twenty minutes. The building was characteristically New Orleans and made me feel like I was staying with family or friends rather than at a hotel. If you are looking for a fancy, corporate Marriot or Sheraton, this is not the place for you. But if you prefer to stay in a cozy and comfortable bed and breakfast type of hotel, the Avenue Garden is the perfect fit. The staff was helpful, friendly, and well-informed about the area. I had no problems getting around by myself. My room was spacious and the interior looked very new. Housekeeping was curteous and kept my room clean and stocked. Overall, I was more than pleased with my experience and would strongly recommend this hotel, especially to those traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Hell Hotel!!!!Hell Manager!!!!!!Owner!!!Whatever!”
Reviews.Author: 601_Queen
Reviews.Content: I checked-in this hotel on a Wednesday, and stayed until Saturday morning as I couldn't get out of the hotel as told by the website I booked with had spoken with the nasty, UNPROFESSIONAL manager. When I arrived, a lady was storming out the door past me. The red flag should've gone off...The nasty manager said to the desk clerk, "MISSISSIPPI" -Yea room #25". Which must be the worst piece-of-crap on the property! I dialed 0 to report the smoke alarm was hanging by the wires, and the curtain was hanging on the 1st day, it had not been remedied even when I checked out. See Pics...They don't change the sheets, but will make your bed. If someone partially use shampoo, you will get the leftovers in your bathroom. For breakfast, on Wednesday there was raisin bread and there was the same bread on Friday morning, too. They will tell you this-and-that is being renovated-a LIE! There was no renovation going on in the kitchen on neither day, and you will walk to the attached restaurant for ice...There's no FREE parking. Get prepared to park on the street, and feed the meters! I complained to the manager which states she just arrived there, but further states that she is the "OWNER". She didn't want to hear anything I had to say, and walked to her room #18. She slammed the door, and that's how complaints are handled. The only positive is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CristinB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during Jazz Fest and was expecting something not so nice but I was pleasantly surprised. We arrived in town very early and they let us check in to our room early and gave us garage parking spot for the whole weekend. The room was very clean and staff was very nice. I was very pleased w/ my stay and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for me”
Reviews.Author: vascale
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on their website with no problems. The location is great, mid-between the French Quarter and the Garden District, both really accessible from the St. Charles street car stop right across the street. It's $1.25 each way for all streetcars, but you can get an all day pass at the desk for $3, or go down to the small market a few blocks down on the same side of the street for a 3 day pass. The hotel staff is nice and will help set up tours, but you can do this either on their computer (free internet) or call from your room. My room was comfy, with a mirror on the ceiling :) They do have balconies, but I wasn't able to get a room with it, instead my view was a blank wall across the alley, but that was ok. The window had a crack in it, housekeeping didn't clean inbetween days in my room, but I saw they did in others. Wasn't a problem though. The shower didn't work for me, but can't say it was broken...may have just been me. Baths were great though. The bed was a king and REALLY comfortable. Staff accomodated a wake up call. They are at the desk until 3am and very helpful with directions and safety measures. GREAT pizza literally 2 steps next door, and great BBQ on corner, 30 seconds away. Would stay here again, definitely. Oh, best part, $59 a night. Can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: ataube59
Reviews.Content: The Avenue Garden Hotel is a nice, small hotel in the Garden District in New Orleans. Located near a bunch of good (and relatively inexpensive) restaurants, it is in a good neighborhood, with easy access to a trolley that takes you to the French Quarter. We had a sizable group (8 people) and the staff bent over backwards to make our stay enjoyable. All of that and price was hard to beat. If you don't expect anything too fancy you will be very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good price”
Reviews.Author: porter_osborne
Reviews.Content: Property is renovated old structure. The style of the hotel give lots of old city feel with most modern conveniences. Was there same weekend as a youth group, so they were a bit noisy, but that can happen in any hotel. trolly stop is right across the street and takes you all the way to canal and st. charles.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Breity2
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying in New Orleans at the Avenue Garden Hotel. We were very impressed with the hotel. With paying such a cheap rate ($59/night), I was a little nervous about what we'd get because 'you get what you pay for'. We arrived in town around 11 a.m. and didn't figure our room would be ready, but figured we'd stop and see anyway. Well, it wasn't so we decided to take the street car down to the French Quarter and start our sight seeing. We left our luggage in the car because we drove down, but they were also willing to store your luggage in a side room for you if you needed to. We had left our phone number with them, so they called us when the room was ready, which was nice so we didn't have to keep wondering. We chose to park on the side streets, not in the garage that was offered, and had absolutely no problems. The hardest time we had finding parking was in the French Quarter, not around our hotel. After checking in, showing us our room and offering to help carry our luggage for us, the girl working the front desk left us to get settled in. Our room was great!! It was number 47 which I would definitely recommend. It was on the top floor on the front so we had two double doors going out to the balcony and a king size bed. They made this room very modern, as well. The bed (king size) was not the most comfortable, but it served its purpose. My only two complaints about this hotel would be the light in the bathroom above the mirror didn't work and the light bulb in the ceiling didn't work all the time as well. My husband was trying to get the bulb in the ceiling to work, and it shattered everywhere. They came up and cleaned it up very quickly, but never got it replaced, so I had to do my hair/makeup in the main room with the light from a lamp. My second complaint is there's no phone in the room. That made our previous problem a little inconvenient. Overall, I would recommend this hotel! It's location was great with the street car right out front and two great restaurants on each side of it! We never walked to the French Quarter, but it was definitely do-able. Kudos to the Avenue Garden Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “location, location, price, location”
Reviews.Author: cheeseandwine
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler who has a set budget. I try to find a a great hotel for a great price so I can spend my money eating New Orleans' wonderful cuisine. This was my first trip to the Avenue Garden Hotel and my stay was nothing short of wonderful. I arrived earlier than the 3:00 p.m. check in time, prepared to wait, but was able to get into my room immediately. Parking was offered to me in a garage behind the hotel which was about a 1/2 block...instead i parked on side of the hotel which was free and closer to the one entrance. The room was a bit small for my taste but it had all the essentials. Furniture was a little outdated but didn't bother me. The room had a king sized bed(comfy bed and pillows), desk and chair, nice size t.v. and a non working fireplace that added a bit of charm. The bathroom may have been a little outdated as well but was well lit by a small window and had great water pressure as well as an abundance of hot water...I love hot showers. The front desk was very helpful in finding me the best spots in town to eat and listen to live music. The street car stops right out front and runs till around 11 which is nice if you are downtown eating a late dinner. The hotel is located in the perfect location. A stones throw to the garden district and arts district and not far from the French Quarter...which takes like 15 minutes to walk to. Being a business traveler I need internet access, and a good night sleep which i was able to get at the Avenue Garden Hotel. by the way, the internet is free. I will definitely be staying here for future trips to New Orleans, business related or not. The great location and the friendly and helpful staff as well as the comfortable and affordable accommodations will keep me coming back!

Reviews.Title: “We got a parking ticket for $20 for staying at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poohmon02
Reviews.Content: We stayed there when a special event was going on and when we got there,the front desk rep. told us that we can park anywhere,because the police dont ticket people on the weekends, so we parked in front of the hotel(on St. Charles Street)because there was no where to park, when we checked in our room we walked back to our car and there was a parking ticket on our car. I would like to say for those who plan to go to Mardi Gras if you want to stay at this hotel, park on Martin Luther king street or on another street, but it is going to be hard to find a parking space because the restaraunts customers park there also, do not park in front of the gree and white house too.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Avenue Garden”
Reviews.Author: BillArkansaw
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in four rooms at the Avenue Garden Hotel over four visits over the years. I'm both cheap and a single traveler, so it is a great hotel for me. When I first started coming to New Orleans, I would compare prices and the AGH was always very reasonably priced compared to its competition. A couple of the rooms I have stayed in were a little on the small side, but they were plenty for just me. The bigger rooms should be enough for a couple. The hotel is located in sort of an odd neighborhood that isn't in any of the destinations, but it is near to all of them. I really don't understand why people would want to pay a severe premium to stay in the French Quarter and the nonsense that it entails when you can stay 5 minutes away for a fraction of the price. The hotel doesn't have a bar or restaurant, but it really wouldn't make sense to have either when there is a perfectly good BBQ joint on one side and an excellent pizza place on the other. Avenue Garden Hotel isn't a fancy place and it isn't a big place, but it is placed right and priced right, so that's all I can really ask for (it also doesn't hurt that the girls behind the desk are cute.)

Reviews.Title: “Great base for New Orleans visit - comfortable, economical & friendly”
Reviews.Author: slc624
Reviews.Content: The Avenue Garden Hotel is a great place to use as a base for a trip to New Orleans. A few small flaws keep it from perfection, but for the price I don't think it can be beat anywhere. I had never visited New Orleans before, so I have no point of reference for the feel of the city and the Garden District, nor for what makes a good price for a hotel there. But since what we paid was less than a Motel 6 here in Wilmington, N.C., (and which is nowhere near either the beach or the river!) and the hotel itself and the neighborhood it lives in were both significantly more charming than the average Motel 6, I call it a fabulous bargain. As a boutique hotel, the Avenue Garden probably offers a wide variety of rooms, so I will specify that we were in Room 16. It's a two-bed double, with two double windows (although the view is nothing to write home about â€“ a brick wall on one side and a vacant lot and cyclone fence, with morning glories, on the other) providing plenty of natural light. The window air conditioning unit wasn't on when we arrived late in a sweltering afternoon, but it cooled off adequately while we were out for dinner. The beds, bathroom, shower, and water pressure were all fine, but the water temperature â€“ "cold" water so warm that no hot needed to be added for an August shower â€“ left something to be desired. The biggest issue we had with the hotel staff was the mystification with which they greeted my request for something nonskid to stand on in the smooth-as-glass bathtub while showering. Apparently their 78-year-old mothers aren't using it! We made do with a towel in the tub. The second-biggest issue was their insistence on making up the entire room every day, removing perfectly good soap and shampoo, when we specifically asked them to leave clean towels only. We also had a minor problem with the remote control for the TV that took four people two days to fix. For those driving to New Orleans or renting a car for the visit, note carefully: the garage is very small, perhaps eight spaces. It is free, which is great, but there wasn't a space available the day we arrived, so the car had to stay on the street in a metered space that needs quarters beginning at 8 a.m. Fortunately, we were having breakfast around the corner and saw some other guests leaving to go check out, so I ran and got the prized garage clicker before I fed any meters. The staff suggested that it would help to mention that youâ€™re driving when you make the reservation, although they didn't go so far as to say that would guarantee a spot as they are first-come, first-serve. There is also a distinct lack of information provided about the hotel's services and offerings, at least in our room. We had to follow a man with an ice bucket to find the ice machine. The desk is open (I think) between 7 a.m. and 11 p.m., with a phone number for other-hours emergencies. There is a breakfast area (it looks like one and one desk clerk referred to it as such), but no breakfast, only coffee â€“ and infuriatingly enough, they turn off the reservoir-style coffee maker so that it takes an hour to heat up and I couldn't even make tea that I brought myself until 8 a.m., after arising at 6 since I was still on Eastern time. The website claims internet access in every room, but since there was no desk and this was among the amenities about which no information was provided, I never even got out my laptop to try and find out. The old, slow computer in the lobby just outside the room sufficed for a quick map search or to check my email. Somehow it got logged off one morning, but the staff got it back up for me when I asked. The staff, except for the two issues noted above, were all very friendly and helpful. There were a couple of unusual aspects to the reservation and they dealt with them in a an outstandingly satisfactory fashion. When I left the keys on the nightstand during a jaunt down on the bayous, they happily let us in when we returned, and they even printed a map for me, out of my email. While it would be a very long and perhaps not recommended walk to the French Quarter, it can also be a pain to drive. Fortunately we went there with family members who were staying there, so I didn't have to drive or pay for a cab. Based upon my observations of traffic, etc., I think I would drive and pay to park in the public lot along the river near the French Market for a daytime visit and take a cab for an evening out in the French Quarter. It's also important to note that the streetcars, as of this writing at the end of August 2007, are still not running along St. Charles Avenue past Lee Circle (coming from the French Quarter). Lee Circle is about 10 blocks away, but I didn't see a likely (safe and comfortable) pedestrian route there. I don't know what the schedule is for restoring streetcar service â€“ once they are back, the transportation issue would be much less important. I might even do without a car on a return trip if the streetcar were running â€“ airport shuttle is $13 each way per person, so for just me it would be a decent savings. Right in the walkable radius of the hotel are several options for food, including Emeril's Delmonico. We didn't eat there, but certainly would give it a try if we hadn't had such a busy schedule already. The best meal we had in three days there was at VooDoo BBQ right next door â€“ so close that the hotel's back patio connects to theirs! A party of six had all the major offerings on the menu but the ribs, and it was all absolutely wonderful, from the pulled pork and brisket to the corn pudding and "gris-gris greens" (mustard) just like Grandma's. St. Charles Tavern around the corner was good for breakfast (think neighborhood bar that morphs into pancake house at dawn, open 24 hours!) but we ran into a real attitude problem on the second visit â€“ look for a separate review shortly. The rest of our party was staying in a nice, slightly larger hotel with a pool, in the French Quarter, for about $20 a night more for a comparable room also including free parking, and walking distance to all the tourist stuff. Those who want to be in the thick of things in the French Quarter may want to spend a little more, especially if they don't plan to drive at all. But for us, with a schedule that included several legs on I-10, accessed only five blocks from the hotel, this one really suited us, and if I go back I will definitely stay there again. As for New Orleans itself, well, there isn't room in a review like this. It was unbelievable all the way around, but to us what is most remarkable is the resiliency of the city and its people. It is still terrible in many places, and we may well have dealt with people whose living conditions are still bad â€“ but in tourist places and elsewhere, they were warm and welcoming and never let on, and we were deeply impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Was like being at home”
Reviews.Author: HeartNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in June of 2004 and had a wonderful time. I have read many reviews and have determined that it all depends on what your expectations are. If you are expecting a posh five star hotel with all of the amenities, then you will be disappointed because this hotel has a bed and breakfast feel to it. It is cozy and comfortable, warm and beautifully decorated. Our stay at this hotel made us feel like it was our home for the seven days we stayed. The staff was wonderful, especially the front desk girl who we actually became friends with. We are getting married next July 2008 and plan to return to New Orleans as part of our homeymoon and will definately be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “disapointed”
Reviews.Author: onhollyday
Reviews.Content: Based on the previous reviews, I expected a little more from this hotel...I don't care if a hotel I stay in is fancy, modern or with a lot of amentities BUT I do care if it is clean. This place did not feel clean and the bedding was very old and questionable... I did not look forward to laying my head down each night. We even switched rooms in hopes of it improving but it did not. The hotel staff was very nice though and the location was pretty convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: apoa17
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for four nights in New Orleans for a convention and with my company I travel a ton and frankly can call the bigger chain hotels home. I asked my company to find a more home -like place to stay and found AGH to be what I was looking for. It's small enough that the staff knew my name yet the hotel provided all the amenities and courtesy of the big names. From check in to check out, I was consistently asked how my stay was and if anything could be done to make it better. The bed and breakfast style hotel was refreshing after a long day. Quiet, friendly and relaxing. There were plenty of places for a quick bite if my schedule demanded it and above all I felt safe, a concern I had staying in downtown New Orleans. The location was perfect for me, far enough away from the hustle and bustle of downtown yet close enough to the city's best restaurants and unique nightlife. I would definitely suggest it to travelers missing home and tired of "business as usual" trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Get Away”
Reviews.Author: momof3beautifulgirls
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great place for a 4 day get-away. The hotel is next door to a fantastic bbq restaurant and short walks to many other wonderful places to eat. The bus line is right in front of the hotel to take you to the French Quarter ($2.50 round trip ride vs. an expensive taxi ride is definitely a plus when staying for several days). Hotel staff were pleasant, room was small but clean, and any requests were handled quickly. The patio was a great way to sit outside, but it is enclosed by the buildings and didn't really provide any views, but that was okay with us because we just wanted to be out enjoying the 70 degree weather. Be sure to visit Donna's on North Rampart for live jazz, good food, and friendly New Orleans people.

Reviews.Title: “Dreary and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: LoveNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews so I thought it was going to be an ok hotel - Well - I walked into this room that smelled like wet towels - the fan did not work - the toilet over flowed and there is absolutely no hot water in the morning or around dinner time - The bathroom floor was dirty and looked like it needed a good scrubbing - The outside chairs were all ripped and dirty - the coffee seemed like it was there for hours and never changed - Overall, a dump - I would never go back and would never recommend this place -

Reviews.Title: “Ok experience but kind of rundown”
Reviews.Author: LydiaGenevieve
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Avenue Garden hotel for our honeymoon and although the room was pretty nice we had a fair amount of problems. I recommend contacting the property directly and checking expedia prices to see which is better, it varies. We were told that there was parking that would be $10 or $15 per day but when we arrived there was no more available, luckily we were allowed to park in the employee parking lot. We had (months ago) requested the honeymoon suite featured on their website with the round red bed but when we arrived we were in the other "honeymoon suite," which was one of the most atrocious rooms I've ever seen. We were able to be moved into the room we had originally requested but when we got in the carpet had litter all over it and there were no towels. These problems were fixed promptly and the room is actually pretty nice. The furniture is pretty neat, nice paint job, etc but there were all sorts of little things that really took away from it. The blinds looked like someone had been shoved into them, one set were pretty mangled and needed replacing. The bedspread was a pretty red velvet but had a big tear on one side and dried wax all over. The bathroom was gorgeous, obviously redone recently but the sink had a wooden base with a chunk missing from it that could easily have been fixed or at least painted over. The shower was extremely difficult to work and although the girl at the front desk was nice when we called about it she had no idea how to work it either. The bed was the major thing, I'm still sore from sleeping in it because it has an egg crate cushioning that is hand made and is in little bits, sliding all around under the sheet and making everything uneven, especially at the head. The details were all lacking, and we will most likely not stay here again. Also, be aware that the trolley out front is still not working.

Reviews.Title: “Completely in love with the Avenue Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the Avenue Garden Hotel. It is an extremely lovely and quaint hotel with excellent service and beautiful rooms. Its location is perfect for those who want to travel to both the French Quarter and to Uptown New Orleans. It is also ideal for those visiting New Orleans during Mardi Gras, as it is situated directly on the parade route. I have thoroughly enjoyed all of my stays at this hotel. I give it two enthusiastic thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels that i have stayed in. It is idealy located on St. Charles and the staff is great. The room was very nice, clean, and spacious. I will definatly be back. i have been visting New Orleans for years both business and pleasure and have stayed in many hotels this on shines above the rest

Reviews.Title: “Charming home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying for the second time at the Avenue Garden Hotel. This inn is located in a series of renovated 19th century townhouses on the St. Charles streetcar line (currently serviced by buses). It is centrally located with easy access to the French Quarter, Arts District, Central Business District, shopping on Magazine Street, Uptown, Garden District, River Bend and the Universities. It would be a perfect place to stay for families dropping off or visiting their Tulane, Loyola, or UNO students. I was in fact visiting my son, a student at UNO. My first visit I stayed in an adorable little room in the rear, very bright and quiet with french doors. This stay I had a beautiful large room in front with a balcony over the street, king size bed with luxurious bedcoverings, and a recently remodeled marble bathroom with shower. The exterior was being painted while I was there and new carpet installed in the stairwell. The young staff is gracious and helped arrange reservations for dinners. There also is excellent pizza and BBQ on the block if you don't feel like venturing far. Although the hotel has not served continental breakfast since Katrina there is a wonderful neighborhood cafe, the Please U, a block and a half away where you can step back in time and enjoy a bottomless cup of coffee, an oyster omelet and grits. This hotel manifests this traveler's dream--good value and location, friendly staff and an authentic sense of place.

Reviews.Title: “Was VERY Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the hotel, and ran into several problems. First, the hotel apparently is getting overbooked by Orbitz. Our double room was converted to two singles (which doesn't work well with a 3 year old), and then we ended up with a single with a rollaway. To date (admittedly, only a few business days since), we have not seen a refund for the room discrepancy. Also, although parking is mentioned as available, it is provided at an extra cost of $10 a day. And that gets you a garage door opener to their storage facility, which houses five cars at best, and requires you to Back out onto a major thoroughfare to leave. Additionally, they oversell the parking, to the point that our last night we were unable to make use of it. They were at least gracious enough to refund the cost of the parking for all nights. Continental breakfast does not exist at this point, post Katrina. Entry to the hotel is through a single front door. Our room was down a hall, outside, then up a stairwell outside. The entrance was a block and a half away from the 'available' parking. Construction work started around 8:30 each day we were there (including a weekend), with the accompanying noises, some of which managed to be just outside our room. Also, our room had a broken water pipe for the shower stall, to the point we could see water leaking through the wall in two places above the shower head. The resultant smell of mold (and possibly a dead animal in the walls) made the bathroom a chore to use. Checkout was 11:30, but the cleaning crew made their first round at 10:30 AM, almost walking in on us when we didn't get to the door fast enough in response to their knocking. There was no 'Do Not Disturb' placard for use.. On checkout, our requests for proof of the room change and requests to see an itemized list of chages were rebuffed.They said they would contact Orbitz about the refund, but they gave us no way to check them on it. Also, their website does not seem to have been updated since Katrina, and is incorrect on at least the continental breakfast. Overall, we were very unimpressed with our time in the hotel. Perhaps we judge it too harshly, but it was not a pleasant stay. The parking fee, the room shuffling (and the questionable refund), the construction noises, the lack of continental breakfast as per their website, the overzealous cleaning crew and the bathroom were just too many problems for the hotel's meager benefit of location.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here twice, and both times were nice!”
Reviews.Author: devisuz
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel two summers in a row for at least 3 nights each time. I have visted New Orleans for two summers, and each time I spent the first few nights of my stay at this hotel. I think it is a charming little place, and very pleasant. You definitely get a taste of New Orleans from this place, and the hotel feels quite homely, which is the reason why I like it most. Our rooms were very spacious, I've probably stayed at four different rooms at the hotel and all of them were spacious, well maintained and very pleasant. It is very nice to take a walk in that area, and it is in a good location (although I always used a car) the street car passes right out front. I'm not sure what is like recently after hearing a few bad reviews since the last time I stayed there, however both times I stayed there, I recall that housekeeping was every day. If I am able to, I plan to stay at this hotel again this summer as I think it is a great find, and reminds me a lot of New Orleans, I have nothing but nice memories of this place.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Ms325i
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-day stay at the Avenue Garden Hotel. It was my first and my boyfriendâ€™s second visit to Nola. We found the hotel on Expedia and booked, not realizing that it would have been actually cheaper to book directly on the hotelâ€™s website. The hotel was easy to find, right on St. Charles in the Garden District. Our review of our stay is as follows: Rooms: -Room was large with King sized bed, nicely decorated, very charming with high ceilings. --Bathroom appears to be newly renovated and has a shower stall (no tub). -Shower in our room had poor water pressure and a faulty shower head, instead of a stream of water you got mist. -The hotel apparently has wireless access in all guest rooms, however service was non-existent during our stay. They do have a computer set up in the lounge area that guests are welcome to use. -Our room had a balcony that faced St. Charles St. We used it throughout our stay to people watch and enjoy the weather. -There is no daily room service. -Rooms do not have phones, alarm clocks or wastebaskets. Restaurants Hits: -Slice pizza next door which smelled delicious and Voodoo BBQ a few doors away, I highly recommend Voodoo, the chicken and brisket were excellent. -The Oceana Grill in the French Quarter is great for fresh fish/seafood and the hurricanes are highly addictive. Misses: -CafÃ© du Monde-beignets are inconsistent. First day we ordered them they were hot, fresh and airy, the second day we ordered them they were cold, spongy and heavy. There is another cafÃ©, CafÃ© Beignet across the street but it was closed for the duration of our stay. - 24 hour St. Charles tavern/restaurant a few blocks down from the hotel, stay far, far away from this place. My boyfriend ate a sandwich there on our last night and became violently ill with food poisoning. We wrote a letter to the health department regarding this incident. We had a car and used it during the day. Streetcars are still not running so we walked to the French Quarter in the evenings and took a cab back to the hotel. There are busses that run along St. Charles, but the service is not very frequent. Because we had a car we were able to venture out of the tourist districts and visit the various districts that were hit by the hurricane. It was encouraging to see the effort being made by residents to help each other get their lives and properties back together. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions regarding our stay.

Reviews.Title: “I loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avenue Garden Hotel for a week in april. It is a real tast of New Orleans. Great staff,and we loved the location. There must be 10 restaurants with in a couple of blocks of the hotel. We are planning to go back to the city in August and will stay at the Avenue garden Hotel. If you want to get a real taste of New Orleans this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel online and reviewed some of the comments and found them to be excellent. I thought there were a few exaggerations because of the price. To my suprise....everything said about this place was true. It was absolutely awesome. New Orleans charm in every corner. Staff was superb. A breath of fresh air away from the regular "hotel scene". Small place which allowed for reading in the courtyard. I went alone for a business trip, but would definetly like to bring a loved one for a romantic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like Home”
Reviews.Author: Banana4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avenue Garden Hotel for three weeks in October. I work for a major news organization and this is where they chose for us to stay. When I was staying at the Avenue Garden it did not feel like the traditional hotel that I am used to staying . This hotel had a real since of home. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone trying to get a real since of New Orleans. The staff were friendly, and the housekeepers were excellent and very pleasent.I know I will come back to New Orleans again for pleasure one day, and I would not stay anywhere else but this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel and amazing Bang for your buck.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a business trip mixed in with a little bit of pleasure. This hotel is the perfect mix between New Orleans charm and modern conveniences. There's free wireless access in the rooms and if you don't have your computer, there's also 2 computers in a little reading room with free internet access. So it's totally convenient and such a pleasant place to stay. Better yet is the location, right on the streetcar line and in the middle of the Garden District. Definitely the best deal in town. Service was friendly and we always had exactly what we needed. I recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to experience New Orleans. We'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Got dibbs on the Balcony Room!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: prefer_boxers2brats
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Avenue Garden. The 1st time we were here, we had two rooms on the first floor near the checkin desk, which were very quiet even though they were on the main hall. This time, we had 3 rooms as we were celebrating my son's 21st birthday & we'd brought friends along. We were just as pleased this time! This hotel is actually two townhouses nestled between a restuarant on either side. If you really want to feel the flavor of New Orleans, this place is perfect. It is very cozy & romantic & we felt very safe no matter what hour we were sitting outside.If you want a VIEW, request one of the balcony rooms in front where you can spend hours watching people go by as we did. (One of them has a round bed in it!) We had the right townhouse upstairs balcony room and our friends had the other room behind ours. Both were enclosed in a tiny hall that made us feel like we had our own wing! There were other rooms that were accessable by the outside porch and we loved the little patio area. We also had #45 downstairs which faced the street and the young people loved it. It was big enough to handle 3 21yrs olds and all their stuff and beautifully decorated. The staff was very helpful and courteous, especially since we arrived between the departure of one tropical storm and the anticipated arrival of the next one. Our beds were quite comfy and we had no noise from the street. Besides the restuarants nearby, there is also a day spa a couple of doors down. We actually own a timeshare at another St. Charles Hotel but we much prefer this hotel over that one ! (we plan to sell the timeshare!) You can book directly with the hotel & get great rates. The management has done a great job with renovations & customer satisfaction. We had one concern (not worth mentioning..)and the staff took immediate steps to correct it for us. We had a great stay in NO and we definately feel that Avenue Garden was an important reason we did...we will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good way to experience N'awlins, but needs some help”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the first trip to New Orleans for my husband and I. We wanted to experience the historical value and culture of the city first-hand, so we opted not for one of the larger, newer hotels downtown - like the Wyndham. We chose the Avenue Garden because it looked quaint online, the price was beyond right, free parking was being offered at the time, and, above all, there were no recent bad reviews. We really value other travelers' comments and, because of that, I hope this review helps others. As other reviewers have said, this hotel has loads of potential and good features - good location, nice artwork on the walls, tall ceilings, secure parking, etc. Larger, structural refurbishments would make this place fabulous. However, there are several low-cost things that NEED to be remedied now: spots on towels, spots on blanket, spots on lamp shade, hole in sheet, not changing sheets daily, permanent rather than replaced-daily bathmat, old and lumpy pillows, etc. These things make ALL the difference between "great" and "wish we would've stayed elsewhere." I wish I would have taken pictures of our room because we were clearly not in one of the recently remodeled rooms; other rooms on this site were much nicer than the one we stayed in. I don't consider myself a "picky" traveler because we don't spend a lot of time in the room when we travel - but the bathroom we had actually made it DIFFICULT to get ready efficiently and get out on your way. It was super tiny (which is something that can't be fixed without lots of $$) BUT, there was no place on the sink for toiletries, a mini garbage can that we quickly overflowed, no place for anything in the shower - I found myself holding my razor in my teeth while I lathered up to shave my legs. Overall: was by no means bad, was much more than worth what we paid, but, sadly, due to the little things, would probably pick another place next time.

Reviews.Title: “stayed during Essencefest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Avenue Garden Hotel during the Essence Music festival. It was one of the only hotels that didn't quadruaple the price during the festival weekend. The highest night was only $149.00 We loved the location and the room was really nice and clean the bath room was beautiful. Most of all there wasn't a foul smell that you sometimes get from hotels in this price range. The Street car stopped directly in front of the hotel. I don't think we could have done any better for the price we paid. There was also breakfast treats in the morining, like coffee, boiled eggs, juice and muffins. I really only had one complaint ... one night after the room was alreadty cleaned for the day my husband and I went out to the concerts around 7:00 pm, when we returned to the room.... someone had come in and taken all the towels... which was really strange. We called the front desk and they said we could come down to the desk and get more, but we still found this creepy.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Garden Avenue Hotel for our 41st wedding anniversary. We had a huge room overlooking St. Charles Street. It was very clean, very nicely furnished and convenient to everything. The streetcar stopped right outside the front door. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was quite nice with English Muffins, Blueberry muffins, Bagels, milk, cereal, coffee, etc. We ate dinner next door at the Voodoo BBQ. The meat melted in your mouth, and was great. We were very pleased with our stay, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay and Close to Everything!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to find a place that was affordable and close to most of the sites such as the riverwalk ,Bourbon Street, ferry boat , zoo, tours, and restaurants. It was perfect. We walked out the hotel door and hopped on the street car and went everywhere! You buy a pass(5.00) for the day and you can ride all day. The Voo Doo BBQ is right next door and I must say it was some of the best BBQ around . The hotel does serve a small breakfast in the mornings and it was nice sitting out on the patio. The hotel is like staying in a Bed and Breakfast. Our room was small, but if you are not planning on living in your room the entire time it is just fine. The room is clean and very comfortable.The staff were all very nice. Lydia who worked at the desk is very helpful and friendly. I would recommend the Avenue Garden Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great place, amazing deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: as two recent college grads, my friend and i were looking for a safe, affodable place to stay in new orleans. the avenue garden was just that. it has a cozy bed and breakfast feel, free breakfast, free internet, friendly staff, a/c, patio, and is very accessible to the french quarter, magazine street and uptown. And for two people for three nights we payed just $115. i couldn't ask for more :>

Reviews.Title: “A great find with great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avenue Garden Hotel from 4/15 to 4/19 and were very happy with the establishment. The hotel could use a bit of work as far as maintenance goes but it's obvious that the owners are trying hard to get it in top shape and keep it up. The privately owned hotel feels like a modified bed and breakfast. The staff was sincere and very accommodating but may not be as knowledgeable as the professionally trained staff from a hotel chain. We didn't get quite the information we were hoping for as far as tours and general information. However, they were courteous and helpful as we needed to store some food items for our 2-year-old in their fridge. The first night, we were given room #45 which was a BIG, very beautiful, stand-alone room with private entry, giant ceiling, beautiful bathroom and architecture. The only problem for us was that it faced the street and was very, very noisy - so we asked for a room change and were re-assigned to room #30. This was a smaller but quiet, private and cozy room on the third floor (it was the only room on that floor). People who may have concerns about climbing a lot of stairs should request not to be put in this room as there are many stairs and no elevator. The room was clean and nice and we had maid service daily, including the carpet being vacuumed (which we really appreciated since our little boy had left several trails of cracker and cereal bar crumbs). The hotel was located right on the St. Charles streetcar line.
