There were plenty of restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel: Slice Pizzeria (check out their calzones) and Voodoo BBQ (not that impressive). The St. Charles Tavern (food was ok, a good place to mingle with the locals) is approximately 20 feet away, a Cajun/Mexican restaurant across the street, a 5-star Emeril restaurant, and fast food restaurants like KFC, Wendy's and Burger King are just around the corner. There is also a Walgreen's and an ice-cream shop 2-3 blocks away and the D-Day museum is within 15 minutes walking distance. You don't need a car when you stay at this hotel. Some previous reviewers stated that the streetcars are always full - you can avoid that by leaving earlier (8:30am - 9:30am). We never had to wait for more than 15 minutes even on the weekend. Safety - the main street seemed pretty safe. There were joggers running in the area all the time. Breakfast - The hotel's breakfast was typical: bagels, English muffins, cereal (two kinds), milk, coffee and orange juice. Nothing fancy but will save you some breakfast $$ if you're on a budget. I was hoping to try out the banana bread some of the previous reviewers were talking about but it was not available during our stay. Price - Incredible value. One piece of advice - shop for the cheapest rate on the web and then call the hotel directly and ask for that rate. That way, you will guarantee yourself the lowest rate and avoid paying the service fees the travel websites charge. Summary - Avenue Garden hotel is not the Hyatt (and you are not paying the Hyatt's rate, either). Unless you're honeymooners, what you need is a comfortable and cozy place where you can have a good night of sleep after a busy sightseeing day, and this place fits the bill. We will stay there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a pleasant long weekend at the Avenue Garden(s?) hotel in New Orleans in late March 2005. The staff were informally pleasant and courteous not fawning, like I have encountered elsewhere in the USA. The breakfast was basic (bagel, muffins, cream cheese, jam, coffee, juice) but suitable. The location is ok, being close to the Garden District and not far from the French Quarter by tram (I might have walked into town in the mornings if I had spent long enough to get my bearings, but I took the tram instead). There was a small amount of mould in the bathroom, but nothing terrible. There was free internet/web e-mail access. I was very pleased with what I got for my money and although I rarely visit the same town twice for pleasure (the world is so big and life is so short!) I would consider staying there again if I was staying in New Orleans again. But if I had a bigger budget I might also stay in a quiet part of the French quarter instead. Basically you get what you pay for and this was the very most I would expect to get for my money. If you book into this place, don't expect the hotel to be the highlight of your stay in New Orleans - it's not a designer hotel experience by any means, just a clean, comfortable pleasant place to stay in while you are touring the swamps/French Quarter/Garden district (the latter is very close by). Having said that, I felt like it was a very suitable place to stay in New Orleans, very good to get a feel for the character of a non-touristy bit of town, rather than some boring generic higher class hotel in the centre of a town. Out of everywhere in the world I have been, the hotel reminded me of cheap, informal, pleasant, quiet hotels in Northern Europe - like Holland. All in all the Avenue Garden(s?) hotel gave me a more positive and fond feeling for America and Americans than I had before I visited the country.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. We couldn't have asked for more especially for the price. The room had a modern decor, and the service was excellent. There is a street car stop in front of the hotel, but it seemed to be crowded most of the time. If you are planning on staying out late on Bourbon St. you may have to wait a while for the street car. I believe someone told us it runs every 30-45min. after midnight. All in all this place was worth it, and I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “not the worst, but not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, well first of all the only nice people in this hotel is the cleaning staff. The front desk people weren't friendly at all. Well, they were friendly when we were paying our bill. They do have a parking garage, but it looks like something that would be in a horror movie! Do not walk through there by yourself, day or night. They do have a free breakfast. I totally suggest the banana bread. It's really good. Sadly, I only had it for 2 mornings because they stopped serving it. The hotel itself is in the perfect location. The trolley line is right in front of it. There are tons of restaurants around it. I suggest the restaurant right beside it, Slice. That's about it, our room was clean, we never ran out of towels, and we had an awesome time in New Orleans! If you're going, have fun and take the Haunted History Tour with Midge!

Reviews.Title: “Needy People Need Not Apply”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was on vacation recently and stayed in The Avenue Garden Hotel. The hotel was cute, but did have major problems: including paint coming off of the walls outside and inside. THE LOCATION IS IT'S BEST ASSET. It's between two great places to eat...VooDoo Bar-B-Que and Slice Pizzaria...It's also right on the street car line and near some beautiful homes. The staff left quite a bit to be desired. If you are someone who doesn't need help finding your way around New Orleans than this place should be fine. Don't ask them any questions! The hotel cleaning staff was great and were the friendliest people I met in New Orleans! The parking garage was around the corner and wasn't that bad. I wouldn't recommend walking down the side street alone at night...but during the day there was nothing to fear. I would recommend using the garage, even though it is super expensive...the neighborhood behind the hotel was a little shady and I wouldn't want my car out there. Let's see...Oh, be careful and make sure that they don't over charge you. I am still waiting on them to refund some of my money! Over all, it wasn't horrible. Again, the location is supreme, but the service wasn't great and it's not the prettiest place in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Cherie4000
Reviews.Content: Ours and three other cars where broken into, the windows smashed in and they stole everything. We were all parked on a neighborhood street next to an exclusive mens health club. Beware of the surroundings, it is not safe. Two weeks before us the same thing happened. Also the hotel was not clean, they overcharged us, and the breakfast was not something to write home about. The paint was chipping off the sides of the building, our balcony had food, and beer cans, and the doors where not secure.

Reviews.Title: “dirty, never again”
Reviews.Author: avabava
Reviews.Content: We were very disapointed with this hotel. After much research and trying to stay budget without sacrificing standards (basically looking for a deal) I settled on Avenue Garden. At the time I don't think there was one bad review the pictures looked great ect. I know it always looks better in pictures but I was really counting on the reviews to tell all. My biggest complaint was the room was filthy. Mold in the corner of the bath, filth around edges of bathroom floor, I don't think it was vacuumed once while we were there. This is a hotel there is no excuse for filth. My husband did not want me to complain (afraid of making the staff mad), so I did not but I should not have had to. It has so much potential it is sad. The fact that the hotel was worn did not bother us. The hotel would be amazing if it was refurbished. We had a great room #20 I think, upstairs, balcony outside but it was the dirtiest room I have ever stayed in. I hear they have different standards in N.O. this was our first and last time to N.O. Loved the carriage ride, swap and plantation tour, that saved our vacation. I guess if you don't mind complaining or cleaning the room yourself then it's not a bad place.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Wedding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had all of our wedding guests stay in the Avenue Garden Hotel. Everyone loved it! The hotel is small and quaint and totally New Orleans. I also found out it's family owned and operated which makes it even better. We picked this place because it was on the streetcar line and in walking distance to tons of restaurants. Our friends were able to take the streetcar into the French Quarter so no one had to worry about renting a car. The hotel manager gave us excellent prices for the wedding party guests and really helped us organize everyone's stay. There were even fresh bouquets of flowers all over the hotel for our wedding. The cute patio was our friends' place to hang out and chat after all of the wedding events. Everyone loved the convenience of the complimentary continental breakfast. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who is having a wedding in New Orleans and wants a fantastic place for your guests.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, and Charming...”
Reviews.Author: m.s.1976
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip to New Orleans and we stayed at the avenue Garden Hotel. i found that the travel package that we ordered gave us a room there with one double bed. I asked the Hotel if I could upgrade to a king bed room and they let me for only an extra $10 a day. I also told them that I wanted a room with a balcony. When we arrived I was amazed at how well they took care of the place, lots of southern art on the walls, very charming. The first room they put us in was nice, but there was no balcony, and the window had a view of a wall, I said I thought we were getting a room with a balcony. She said if we waited a few minutes that they would put us in one of their newly renovated rooms, so we had lunch at the voodoo bbq, which by the way is excellent, and when we came back they showed us to our room. We were the first people to ever stay in this room, since the renovation, and it was beautiful, with a private balcony and wicker furnature. The bed was huge with a satin comforter and pillows. The bathroom was all marble, this room was so charming that I felt right at home. Their continental breakfast was great with hard boiled eggs, and orange juice milk bagels english muffins and coffee or tea. The street car is a pain I wouldnt reccomend taking it its always very crowded and its hard to find the right stop if you dont know your way around. The restuarants I would reccomend is Emerils Delmonico, its about 3 block away, Le Madeline was also really good and within walking distance, and this Italian restuarant called Bravo is right up the street as well in walking distance, voodoo bbq is good too and reasonably priced. St. Carles tavern is across the street and its alright but the good thing about that place is that its open all night. I would reccomend going to the river walk and seeing the aquarium, and take a boat ride. Be careful if you go to Bourbon street past 10pm there are alot of pick pockets, this guy had come up to us and put mardi gras beads around our neck and then asked for a donation, he said he was starving and I felt sorry for him so I pulled out my money I only had 8 bucks I was going to give him 3 and he grabbed all the money out of my hand aggressively and ran. I am glad I was not carrying alot of money, if someone tries this with you dont let them put beads on you and tell them you are not interested unless you want to get mugged and keep your purse very close to your body and hold onto it tightly. I had a wonderful time in New Orleans and the Avenue Garden Hotel is a great place with kind southern hospitality. I am quite sure you will be pleased with it. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Worth $53, but watch your credit card bill!”
Reviews.Author: brainman73
Reviews.Content: I was prepared to give the hotel a 4 (of 5) rating, except for one snafu, which I will describe later, that dropped my rating to a 3. The hotel certainly not a "4-star hotel" by the standard definition, but it deserves 4 stars based on the price-to-quality ratio. My wife and I, who are both "poor" students, stayed there 3 nights, right before Christmas, and paid $53/night. The hotel was acceptable; the hotel itself was definitely a good value for the price and location, especially considering most other hotels in the ZIP code were nearly twice as expensive. It's not in the heart of the French Quarter, but that section is loud and crowded anyway, so I liked being a mile away from the "action." The St. Charles trolley stops 20 ft. from the hotel door and will take you right to Burbon Street/French Quarter within 10 minutes, so, if you want to save $30-$50 by not staying in the F.Q., this hotel is a good bet. The best deal for transportation is to buy a 3-day trolley/bus pass, which is available for $12 at Williams Grocery about 8 blocks up St. Charles. (It's easy to miss the sign, unless you're walking on the opposite side of the street.) If you fly in, don't rent a car unless you must. Parking is scarce and expensive, and the streets are narrow and confusing. We took the E-2 bus, which runs from the airport's upper deck right into the heart of the N.O. business district (downtown). It is about a 10-15 block walk to the hotel from the final stop of the bus to the hotel. It's around a 15 minute walk, quite an exercise when you're towing luggage, but it is not too bad compared to the $26-$28 that you would spend on a cab or a shuttle for two. The hotel is fairly clean, though older. It is like a mediocre bed and breakfast. There were places that could have used a touch of paint, and there was a little rust on the metal fixtures. You must be rung into the building by someone at the front desk, and there is no one manning the desk in the middle of the night (11 pm to 7 am, I believe), so they give you a key to get into the hotel along with your room key. All in all, though, it was not that bad. Unless you're used to staying in the Ritz-Carlton, this is a fine choice for those on a budget. Besides, when you're a tourist to N.O., you don't really spend much time in the hotel anyway. Each morning, there is a continental breakfast. It's decent--bagles, English muffins, cereal with milk, orange juice; one morning there was also cinnamon bread and hard-boiled eggs. There is almost always free Twinnings tea and mediocre coffee (though sometimes they ran out of tea bags; you can ask for more, though). Next to the small eating area (gets crowded in the morning), there is a small outdoor patio where you can eat if the weather permits. There is also a sitting room/computer room. Internet use is free, but there is sometimes a line of 2-3 people waiting to use the one computer during popular hours. The decoration of this room is a bit tacky and outdated (ugly green cover on the couch, old unread books on bookshelves, antiquated computer manuals with the books, etc.). The room was acceptable, TV had dozens of cable channels, bathroom was fairly clean, and maid was competent. There was no "Do Not Disturb" doorhanger, so I guess you have no choice about maid service. The bed was large and comfortable, and the room, as promised, included ironing board, table, chairs, and extra pillow. There was an ice bucket, but it did not come with a liner bag, and I never saw an ice machine anyway, so we didn't use the bucket. The staff seemed nice, but I didn't get the extreme friendliness that other people have reported. We arrived a few hours early, and William let us check in early after a 15-min wait to get the room ready, so that was nice. He wasn't especially friendly, but was not rude either; he was just "there." The other staff members were just "there" for us too. I have no specific complaints or praises for them. The one main complaint I have happened one week after we checked out. We prepaid for the room, so we did not have to pay when we checked in or out. However, since we had paid in advance, when we checked in, we were charged a provisional $60 to offset any expenses we might incur while there. This was fine with me; many hotels do this, and I knew we would have no other expenses of importance on the room. We were supposed to have this provisional charge refunded when we left if there were no other charges. While we were there, the only additional expenses we had were 2 local phone calls (35 cents each)--that's it. Well, a week after we checked out, I viewed my credit card statment and found that we had been charged $43 extra!! (not 70 cents!) I immediately called the hotel and asked for the reason for this charge. The woman who answered appeared to be new. She looked at my account in the computer and could not find any record of this extra charge. She said (this is a direct quote), "We didn't make no charges on your card." I told her I was looking right at my credit card statement with the extra $43 charge, so someone obviously did. She could not explain it, so I asked that William to call me the next day, since he was the one who checked me in. I thought maybe he could explain the extra charge. I didn't receive a phone call, but I did contact my credit card company to challenge the bogus charge, and they took it off. I'm still not sure why this charge was made, so I recommend anyone staying at this hotel to double-check your credit card statement to make sure your card is properly charged. If it hadn't been for this frustrating surprise, I would have granted the hotel a 4 rating. I would probably stay here again if I return to N.O., but I'll be sure to watch the charges to my card.

Reviews.Title: “The Charm of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our anniversery for a nice little gettaway. We were on a budget so we were not looking to spend much money. Luckily, I found this hotel and was not expecting such an awsome little place for only $69 a night. It deffinitley gave off the unique charm of New Orleans and had that Southern Hopitality atmosphere throughout. The frontdesk workers were so helpful and friendly, which is one of the main reasons why I know we will be staying here again next visit to New Orleans. The location is perfect because it is right smack dab in the middle of the garden distriict and the French Quarter, which allowed us to veiw other areas of New Orleans besides Bourbon Street. We stayed in a beautifully decorated room facing St. Charles Avenue, which is their honeymoon suite. They upgraded our room to this suite when they realized it was our anniversery. The suite had a red velvet circular bed and a mirror on the ceiling... very romantic, and is located on the second floor of this to die for pizzaria. We loved the Avenue Garden Hotel and make sure you ask about those suites ... i know we will next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth $55 a night”
Reviews.Author: italianchick163
Reviews.Content: First I will say we left the Avenue Garden Hotel due to just basically hating the place. We got to the hotel and the room I was told we were booked in was "under construction" and we couldn't stay in it. I was told we would be in a revamped room when we booked with a new bathroom. They moved us to another room and it did look clean, but looked like it wasn't remodeled in about 30 years. The baseboard in the bathroom was splintering off and mold was around the base of the tub. The room had a view of a brick wall and had really no character. Let's say the holiday inn or best western is way above. We would have been paying $55.00 a night and that room was NOT worth $55.00 a night. So we thought we could deal with it, tried to be in good spirits, and went out for lunch. About 6 hours later we get back and open the door to find our luggage is missing and a note says our bags are moved and to go to the front desk. We were told our room had termites and they moved us to room 12. This room was right next to the front desk and was totally loud and noisy. We found a bag of half eaten chips in the room, the toilet seat was dirty and again the atmosphere was just depressing. Needed major work on the bathroom especially. We decided we needed to leave. I was not going to let the room ruin our trip. The front desk person was VERY nice and understanding and didn't give us any problem. He worked with us and gave us our money back, I think he knew we felt cheated. As we were waiting for him, we saw a hotel staff member bringing wine to the remodeled room we were supposed to have in the beginning, so they obviously lied to us about the under construction excuse and had given away the room to someone else. It just seems like this place has potential, but needs work. They should have remodeled the whole place before they opened it. They had the water turned off for about 6 hours that day on the one half of the hotel and I know people were at the front desk complaining about not being able to shower or shave. The hotel's solution was to let them into an unoccupied room in the other side of the hotel to use the bathroom, they were trying to be helpful. I also think the location is not great. It's in a kind of ugly section of town inbetween the garden district and the Business District. For first-time traveleres to New Orleans, this place is not a good option because you won't get the true New Orleans expereince unless you stay in the or close to the Quarter. If you are a college kid who does not CARE at all about the room and you are planning on just somewhere to crash, this place is OK. But if you are a couple looking for a romantic place, a business traveler or family, this place is not for you. It has a small amount of potential to be a nicer place, they just need to get organized and work out the kinks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avenue Garden Hotel in late October. First of all, the city is so much fun during Halloween. I think everyone should go there one year. If you do go, you should stay at the Avenue Garden Hotel, they have the best customer service I have seen in a long time. Everyone from the front desk staff, housekeeping to even the owner are helpful with whatever I may have asked. The hotel has a great New Orleans charm to it, they have a FREE breakfast in the morning, the streetcar is directly outside the front door of the hotel making it so easy to get back and forth to the hotel from the French Quater. There is so much to do in this area of the city even though it is not in the main area, the French Quater. It is in this area the locals call the Garden District, it is an old area of New Orleans that the homes are like masions, they are amazing, it is for sure the most beautiful area in New Orleans that I saw. Bourbon Street was fun for a few nights, but if you want to be somewhere that you can walk out the door and have tons of restaurants and bars and still have the beautiful scenery of the streetcar and nice homes, Avenue Garden Hotel is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not too Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Avenue Garden Hotel back in August 2004 and the room was nice for the price. The hotel use to be a house and there is a long hallway as soon as you enter the hotel. The front desk is really small and located about midway down the hall. The owners have made great use of the space and the decor is really nice but the view from your room leaves something to really be desired. All in all we enjoyed our stay and it is located right on the streetcar line and the 2 places that I would highly recommend for dining would be #1 Copeland's Cheesecake Bistro on St. Charles Ave and #2 Voodoo's Bar-B-Que also located on St. Charles Ave. I would definitely stay at this hotel again especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: chocksaway
Reviews.Content: This place is perfect for the budget traveler. We stayed for four nights, booked through Orbitz.com for a rate of $55 per night. This is not a high-end hotel, more of a B&B feel to it. However the room was great, comfortable and bathroom was nice. View was non-existent but we didn't spend much time in the room. Breakfast is extremely basic so set your expecations appropriately there. The St Charles Ave streetcar could not be more convenient to get to the French Quarter and to the Garden District. The area is completely safe and in fact is quite full of restaurants and bars. I agree that Voodoo restaurant, right next door, is good value. We parked on the sidestreet without any problems. Out of all the hotel staff we encountered, we found Kristen to be extremely good. This place is perfect budget accomodation in a very convenient location. I would stay here again without question. If you are looking for something more glitzy, or a romantic weekend with a date etc, you might want to choose somewhere more upmarket.

Reviews.Title: “Below average at best”
Reviews.Author: KeeperOfTheCastle
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. The room was very small and not cleaned very well at all. There was soap scum in the sink and mold in the shower. The comforter on the bed had spots on it and you could tell that it was not washed after the last occupant.The building is very old and is need of repair.The railing on the steps to the second floor was loose and ready to fall off.My room was off a porch on the second. I had to enter my room from the porch. The light on the porch did not work and I could barely see to get the key in the door. The wood floor on the porch was soft from water damage and rot. It was covered with a carpet but I could feel it sink down when I walked on it. I would not ever stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of all the great reviews posted on this website. We arrived in late afternoon, and was told by the receptionist that our room had a plumbing problem and we could not check in. Very nicely, he handed us a broucher for another Bed and Breakfast and ensured us a reservation has been made for us, and that it was a great place. Being as "innocent" as we are, we took her words at face value, and found us arriving at a place where, lets say, an adult male do not feel comfortable walking around. The "Bed and Breakfast" itsself is a room rented out by a Swedish couple who do not speak English. We called Anenue Garden Inn right away and hoping there was a mistake, but was told that is the place. After much "heated discussion" with Anenue Garden, they finally admitted that they do not know this place, and only selected it because there is vacancy. They also admitted that there are actually other rooms available for us in thier very own hotel. However, at that time, we do not feel like being a customer of a place that treated their customer so badly in the first place. We ended up having to scramble looking for a place to stay and finally settled down at 8pm with another hotel. Our New Orleans experience is badly tinted...

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: agac
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here with my spouse. It was our first visit to NO.We based our decision to stay here on the wonderful reviews about the hotel- BIG MISTAKE. The location is on the fringe of the garden district, if you expect to be surrounded by beautiful mansions, your in the wrong area. We were placed in the adjoining building. Our room was very tiny, no room for our luggage, walls were very thin we could here everything in the adjoining room. Bathroom is in need of major renovations, we saw mold and the shower curtain looked like it had spent some time in the bayou.Housekeeping was nothing to write home about.Staff omitted to provide us with towels or soap and left garbage bags in the room.If you want to stay in the Garden district there were nicer hotels a few blocks down the street.After our stay, my wife and I were wondering if we had stayed in the same hotel that everyone is raving about.

Reviews.Title: “awesome little hotel- A+++++”
Reviews.Author: lizzie241
Reviews.Content: Great PlaceTo Stay- Garden District Is Great with many restaurants in walking distance... BRAVO, VOODOO BARBQ AND PONCHATRAIN CAFE-ASK FOR MICHAEL AWESOME WAITER. We ate at all 3 of them. TROLLEY STOPS RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET.. Our room number was 44 .WAS NEAT CLEAN FRESHLY PAINTED..comfy bed- Very quiet with a cute courtyard for breakfast--Try the homemade poppyseed coffee cake-.FELT VERY SECURE-Paid extra 18 dollars a day for garage, we had our own clicker and could go and come as we pleased. STAFF AWESOME-Kirsten was great and Alexis too.Housekeeping was really good too.Its family run-you can tell- homely feel.. They also had a computer to check email etc. NICE... WE WILL RETURN... YOULL LOVE IT..

Reviews.Title: “We'll be staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I loved this place. The location was great (assuming you don't want to be in the Quarter). We just hopped on the streetcar and it dropped us off at Canal & Bourbon. The room was charming and clean. The front staff were friendly and helpful. AND our favorite thing about Avenue Garden Hotel ... VooDoo BBQ next door. Best meal we had in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: L just want to say this is one off the best Hotel to stay at in new orleans. Everything was right there from places to eat to street car picking you right up at the door.And the people there are so great Thanks to Alexis for all her help while we were there she was the most plesant and happy all the time and had a answer to everything we need. Thanks girl i miss you already.Hope to see ya soon.m.j.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful hotel & concierge's in new orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and a few buddies arrived in New Orleans after a long drive to escape the hurricanes in Florida. Once we checked into the Hotel we were greated by gorgeous smiles and the best service we have experienced in the whole of the USA. Thanks to first class service we soon started to relax and enjoy ourselves once again. Hopefully this review will encourage others to stay at such a wonderful hotel, and I'm sure you will have as good a time as us if you do. By the way the locattion was very good and the prices were very reasonable too. Special thankyou to all the staff especially Kristen and Alexis. Love Jerome Andy Stevie Mark Daylo

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had the Queen Suite, we loved it! The room was tastefully done. The desk clerks were so nice and so willing to help make sure the stay was going well. The trolley stop was right out the door. Our room was on the bottom floor in a another building.We were able to come come and go without even going in the hotel. The only thing about this room is you do have street noise. BUT we still loved it! I recommend this room to anyone who doesn't mind the noise from the street. The air conditioning worked great. Copelands which is about 3-4 blocks down has the BEST cheesecake ever!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a gem! A friend came into town for a "moms' weekend away," so we just wanted something inexpensive and clean. The hotel served our purpose -- a clean place to sleep and shower. Plus it was close to the street car, the restaurants, and the spa we were visiting. Our room was very quiet, although other rooms were closer to the stairs and we wondered if those guests suffered from all the guests walking past -- i don't know. The front desk clerk was very friendly and we felt safe and comfortable. The only challenge is parking. St. Charles has a lot of restrictions (meters) and the side streets get sketchy pretty fast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central to the downtown area, french quarter and nearby restaurants as you can hop on the St. Charles streetcar (right accross the street) to get around. It's about a 5-10 minute ride into the downtown area..then you can walk to the french quarter or hop on another trolley with your pass to get to the french market, riverwalk, convention centre, casino, and other attractions. Our family of of four slepted very comfortably in a large room with two double beds. Each bed was in a separate area..each with it's own tv. The rooms were very clean, fresh towels every morning, good airconditioning and ceiling fans over each bed. The bathroom was very clean and included a hair dryer. Breakfeast was served from 7:30-9:30 every morning. This included coffee, juice, milk, cereal, bagels, english muffins and boiled eggs. There is a lovely patio area and sitting room with a computer that has internet access. I was able to check my email every day. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. A 3 day pass for the streetcar can be purchased at Winstons Grocery Store just down the street from the hotel. The pass will give you unlimited access to the trolley both on the St. Charles line and another downtown one for the three days. It runs every 5 minutes until 12am each night..this mode of transportation was very convenient and is very safe. We ate very well at the following restaurants..voodoo bbq, mothers, delmonicos (extremely pricely, but well worth it!), cafe du monde, and the cheesecake bistro. We went on the Steamboat Natchez Riverboat (not worth the price) and a tour of the Laura Plantation..good tour but would have liked to see a very traditional Southern Plantation..this was a Creole Plantation. Great jazz club to check out is Snug Harbor Bistro..nice atmosphere..amazing music and reasonably priced food and drink.

HotelInfo.Name: Avenue Garden Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1509 St. Charles Ave., New Orleans, LA 70130
